name: Umbrella Use Case Identified
summary: Product Development & Customer Insights: Bass Pro is exploring AI strategy integration with Domo and how it fits with Cortex. This indicates they're looking to leverage advanced analytics for business insights.
rationale: Kevin mentioned they are 'trying to figure out their AI strategy where we fit, where cortex fits how we play together' which aligns with the Product Development & Customer Insights umbrella use case.
action_context: 1. Schedule a dedicated AI strategy session to align Domo's capabilities with Bass Pro's vision. 2. Prepare use case examples showing how Domo's AI features can deliver specific business value. 3. Create a roadmap for AI implementation that integrates with their existing Snowflake environment.
recommended_action: Schedule an AI strategy session to demonstrate Domo's AI capabilities for forecasting and inventory management
signal_rationale: Multiple signals indicate Bass Pro is exploring AI integration (signal 6ac46e9c mentions 'trying to figure out their AI strategy') and specifically needs AI for forecasting during critical business events like their Fall Hunting Classic (signals bb51200e and b3a7a7b8). They currently use a Churchill forecasting system with manual overrides (signal 058e2b5b), presenting an opportunity to demonstrate how Domo's AI can enhance their existing tools. Jesse Knapp was identified as a key stakeholder in demand planning who could benefit from AI-powered forecasting (signal e35fdb70).
Play 1 Name: AI Agents & Readiness - Seamless AI integration with targeted assessments and strategies.
Play 1 Description: Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: supports organizations in preparing for and deploying AI use cases in Domo. This includes evaluating your current data landscape, identifying AI-ready use cases, recommending ML tools or integrations (such as Domo’s AI Service Layer or 3rd party connectors), and developing governance around AI usage. The goal is to enable intelligent automation, predictive insights, and human-AI collaboration through a controlled, value-driven approach.
Play 2 Name: New Product Sprints - Launch and iterate on new products swiftly with focused sprint methodologies.
Play 2 Description: Non-Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: enable teams to rapidly plan, document value and ROI, and prototype use cases with new features within Domo using sprint methodologies. Each sprint includes ideation, solution design, rapid development, user feedback, and iteration. This accelerates time-to-value for new dashboards, apps, and decision tools while encouraging a culture of innovation and continuous delivery.

name: CDW Identified
summary: Bass Pro is working with Snowflake as their cloud data warehouse. The conversation indicates they are further along in their Snowflake integration, which represents an important architectural component for the Domo implementation.
rationale: Kevin mentioned 'they're further down the jetway on their snowflake integration' when referring to Bass Pro, clearly indicating Snowflake is being used as their cloud data warehouse.
action_context: 1. Ensure Domo-Snowflake connector is properly configured and optimized. 2. Review Bass Pro's Snowflake architecture to identify optimization opportunities. 3. Leverage Domo's Snowflake best practices to enhance their implementation.
recommended_action: Implement Domo-Snowflake optimization and architecture assessment
signal_rationale: Multiple signals confirm Bass Pro is using Snowflake as their cloud data warehouse (signals 8bcc6855, 0f4c78e2, 4cf2082d) with an 'imminent migration' mentioned. They're experiencing technical issues with OAuth authentication (signal 0f4c78e2) and performance problems with large data volumes causing timeouts (signal 374aca44). Robert mentioned 'trouble when I run the whole job just because of its size,' indicating architectural optimization is needed. A comprehensive assessment would address these issues while ensuring optimal integration between Domo and Snowflake.
Play 1 Description: Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: deliver a comprehensive evaluation of your entire Domo implementation, including data modeling, governance structures, user roles, content hierarchy, and security protocols. The assessment benchmarks your environment against Domo best practices and enterprise standards, providing a roadmap for remediation, optimization, and future readiness
Play 2 Name: Domo Architecture Assessments
Play 2 Description: Non-Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: deliver a comprehensive evaluation of your entire Domo implementation, including data modeling, governance structures, user roles, content hierarchy, and security protocols. The assessment benchmarks your environment against Domo best practices and enterprise standards, providing a roadmap for remediation, optimization, and future readiness
Play 3 Description: Non-Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: provides a health check and performance audit of your Domo environment. It includes evaluation of dataflows, dataset duplication, memory usage, dashboard performance, connector health, and governance controls. The result is a set of prioritized recommendations to streamline performance, improve manageability, and extend platform longevity.

name: Champion Affirmed
summary: Brittany has been identified as a champion who 'gets stuff done' and is 'highly motivated.' Andy specifically praised her ability to organize teams and make meaningful progress, indicating she's a key driver for Domo adoption.
rationale: Andy explicitly stated: 'she gets stuff done... She's highly motivated. She does a good job of organizing teams. She does a good job of making meaningful progress.' This clearly positions Brittany as someone who champions initiatives and drives them forward.
action_context: 1. Strengthen relationship with Brittany through regular check-ins and support. 2. Provide Brittany with additional resources/enablement to help her champion Domo more effectively. 3. Consider featuring her success stories in case studies or customer spotlights.
recommended_action: Develop a technical enablement plan with Brittany to strengthen her champion role
signal_rationale: Multiple signals identify Brittany as a strong internal champion (signals d40e38e1 and edcd1e91) who 'gets stuff done' and 'drives execution and accountability.' Andrew stated he 'sleeps better at night' because of Brittany's leadership. Signal 6a3f3c81 indicates Casey offered a technical adoption consultant to help with areas Brittany identified for improvement. Strengthening Brittany's champion role through targeted enablement will accelerate adoption and maximize platform value across Bass Pro.

name: CDW Identified
summary: The customer mentioned BigQuery as their cloud data warehouse, expressing interest in learning how to pull data directly from BigQuery tables rather than Excel pivot tables. This presents an opportunity to demonstrate Domo's native BigQuery connector capabilities.
rationale: Todd explicitly stated: 'I'm kind of interested in learning how to pull in data from the… background or whatever you call it, you know, like from the actual like data tables from bigquery.'
action_context: 1. Schedule a technical demo specifically focused on Domo's BigQuery connector. 2. Provide documentation on best practices for BigQuery-to-Domo data pipelines. 3. Consider offering a guided hands-on session to help Todd build his first BigQuery connection.
recommended_action: Schedule a technical demo focused on Domo's BigQuery connector capabilities and data pipeline optimization
signal_rationale: Multiple signals indicate Home Depot is using BigQuery as their cloud data warehouse and experiencing challenges with data handling. Todd specifically expressed interest in learning how to pull data directly from BigQuery tables rather than Excel pivot tables. Jason is actively using BigQuery connections but mentioned integration challenges. The large dataset of 77 million records they're working with requires optimized data handling. A technical demo would address these needs while showcasing Domo's competitive advantages over their current Tableau implementation.

Call Title: Domo + Home Depot: Merchandising Working Session
Call Attendees: Phil Stewart, No Title, Domo; Todd Budzinski, Merchandisng Director, Client; Matthew Newsom, Solutions Consultant, Domo; Benjamin Parker, Senior Program Manager, Domo
Call Recap: Benjamin, Phil and Matthew from Domo, along with Todd from Home Depot U.S.A., Inc., discussed a collaboration to leverage Domo's data analytics platform to help Todd's team at Home Depot make data-driven decisions on product assortment and placement around the paint desk in their stores. The key highlights include Todd's interest in creating a sales index dashboard to track paint item performance, the potential for A/B testing different paint desk configurations, and the plan to work together to import and clean up Todd's data in the Domo platform, with the goal of providing more visibility and insights to support the decision-making process.

name: Use Case Name Identified
summary: Paint Category Management was specifically identified as the initial focus area for the Domo implementation. This provides a clear, defined scope for the proof of concept that can later be expanded to other merchandise categories.
rationale: Todd confirmed: 'I'm on paint right now. So, like that's like the category that I'm like training' and Phil acknowledged this focus area: 'I know from my notes we wanted to pick, I think you'd mentioned like paint, you know, could be a really good category.'
action_context: 1. Create a tailored proof of concept focused specifically on paint category metrics and KPIs. 2. Research paint industry-specific metrics that might be valuable to include. 3. Design the solution to be templated for easy expansion to other product categories later.
recommended_action: Develop a proof of concept for the paint department SKU analysis use case with Todd from merchandising
signal_rationale: Multiple signals indicate an emerging use case in the paint department with significant revenue potential. Todd is working in the paint department and expressed interest in using Domo. Phil mentioned this use case could impact "a million dollars a month" by optimizing product placement and impulse purchases. Todd has prior Domo experience from Target, making him a potential champion. The merchandising team currently relies heavily on Excel pivot tables, presenting an opportunity to demonstrate Domo's superior capabilities.

Call Title: Domo + Home Depot: Merchandising Working Session
Call Attendees: Phil Stewart, No Title, Domo; Todd Budzinski, Merchandisng Director, Client; Matthew Newsom, Solutions Consultant, Domo; Benjamin Parker, Senior Program Manager, Domo
Call Recap: Benjamin, Phil and Matthew from Domo, along with Todd from Home Depot U.S.A., Inc., discussed a collaboration to leverage Domo's data analytics platform to help Todd's team at Home Depot make data-driven decisions on product assortment and placement around the paint desk in their stores. The key highlights include Todd's interest in creating a sales index dashboard to track paint item performance, the potential for A/B testing different paint desk configurations, and the plan to work together to import and clean up Todd's data in the Domo platform, with the goal of providing more visibility and insights to support the decision-making process.

Play 1 Name: AI Agents & Readiness - Seamless AI integration with targeted assessments and strategies.
Play 1 Description: Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: supports organizations in preparing for and deploying AI use cases in Domo. This includes evaluating your current data landscape, identifying AI-ready use cases, recommending ML tools or integrations (such as Domo’s AI Service Layer or 3rd party connectors), and developing governance around AI usage. The goal is to enable intelligent automation, predictive insights, and human-AI collaboration through a controlled, value-driven approach.
Play 2 Name: New Product Sprints - Launch and iterate on new products swiftly with focused sprint methodologies.
Play 2 Description: Non-Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: enable teams to rapidly plan, document value and ROI, and prototype use cases with new features within Domo using sprint methodologies. Each sprint includes ideation, solution design, rapid development, user feedback, and iteration. This accelerates time-to-value for new dashboards, apps, and decision tools while encouraging a culture of innovation and continuous delivery.

name: External Integration

account_name: United Parcel Service Oasis Supply Corporation
name: Architecture Gap Identified
summary: The customer is experiencing issues with promoting partitioned datasets from sandbox to production. This architectural limitation impacts their development workflow and creates confusion in their ETL promotion process.
rationale: Mamta identified that 'we are not fully supporting partition via sandbox' and explained that 'partitions and recursives as a best practice, we build it in prod itself.' Raymond acknowledged this was 'a little upside down to what we're used to,' confirming this is an architectural gap in their current workflow.
action_context: 1. Provide clear documentation on best practices for handling partitions and recursives. 2. Consider scheduling a technical workshop to align on development workflows. 3. Review the customer's current ETL promotion process to identify potential improvements.
recommended_action: Schedule Domo Architecture Assessment to address sandbox-to-production migration issues
signal_rationale: Multiple signals indicate recurring issues with sandbox-to-production migrations, particularly with partitioned datasets, variable controls, and app promotions. Raymond is 'constantly reaching out' for access to datasets created in the virtual machine. There are specific errors when promoting cards from UAT to production, with Mamta noting 'we are not fully supporting partition via sandbox' and recommending building in prod directly. These architectural limitations are causing workflow bottlenecks and preventing efficient deployment of critical dashboards, including healthcare reporting.

This represents a significant opportunity to replace manual processes with automated reporting and provide leadership with more comprehensive forecasting capabilities.

name: Sandbox Migration Identified
summary: The team is experiencing issues with promoting content from sandbox (UAT) to production, related to permissions limitations. This migration challenge is causing workflow bottlenecks and preventing Raymond from efficiently moving his work to production.
rationale: Raymond mentioned 'we had some issues with the sandbox and committing promoting' and later clarified that while he can edit in UAT, he may not need edit rights in production as long as he 'can push what's in UAT to prod.' Brian also referenced 'errors that we were seeing when you were sandboxing over.'
action_context: 1. Review sandbox-to-production promotion workflow and identify specific permission barriers. 2. Work with Gupta to implement appropriate role-based access that enables smooth promotion without compromising security. 3. Document the promotion process for Raymond's team once resolved.

account_name: United Parcel Service Oasis Supply Corporation
name: Feature Gap / Request
summary: Raymond identified a permissions gap where he lacks access to view datasets created in the virtual machine and needs to constantly request access. This gap is impacting workflow efficiency and creating dependency on the admin team for basic data access.
rationale: Raymond stated: 'when I create, a job, in the virtual machine as soon as I run, it creates a dataset and that dataset is invisible to me. Only you can see it. So that's why I'm constantly reaching out. Hey, can you give me access to this?' This clearly indicates a feature limitation affecting his ability to work independently.
action_context: 1. Explore interim solutions such as group permissions as suggested by Brian. 2. Communicate timeline for Enterprise Workbench migration which Gupta indicated would resolve this issue. 3. Document this as a known limitation to set proper expectations.

AI Account Signal Context: Implement Architecture Assessment and Optimization for Multiple System Integration, Implement HR & Talent Acquisition Data Product for Employee Analytics, Provide App Studio Training and Enablement for Portal Development
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: The client is struggling with inefficient workflows due to manual data transfers between multiple systems (Monday.com, Carestitch, Kinzer, Snowflake, etc.). Inna explicitly stated 'we just copy information from one program and entering to another, just manually, which actually not very optimal' and 'we're losing our resources.' Multiple signals indicate integration challenges with systems like Lever, Paylocity, and RingCentral. The client has expressed interest in consolidating systems and reducing manual work, with Bellamy stating they're 'trying to move it to Salesforce' and want to 'tie every single one of our back end office functions into one environment.', Multiple signals indicate a strong need for HR and talent acquisition analytics. The client is building department dashboards for HR and TA with specific requirements for tracking employee turnover, reasons for termination, and hiring metrics. Bea (HR) stated 'I want it by region. I want it by title. I want it by reason why they're leaving voluntary versus involuntary.' Kevin (head of TA) needs 'real time data that he needs to understand different hiring needs.' The client has identified Lever and Paylocity as key data sources for these metrics, making them ideal candidates for a comprehensive HR data product., The client is actively exploring App Studio for building clinician portals and customer reports. Bellamy mentioned 'we actually went into the app studio and figured things out ourselves' but also stated 'we do have some questions like it's very elementary, you know, like things like drill downs.' The signals show they've begun self-learning but need additional enablement to maximize this feature. Benjamin identified 'stakeholder portals' as a key use case, 'primarily for the clinicians' with plans to expand to other departments. This represents a significant opportunity to increase platform adoption through proper enablement.

They agreed to start with the provided building blocks and iterate on the dashboards as needed, with plans to set up integrations with various data sources like Paylocity, Lever, and Kinzer/Wellsky, and to incorporate metrics such as open roles, employee churn, and clinician compliance.

Inna explicitly stated 'we just copy information from one program and entering to another, just manually, which actually not very optimal' and 'we're losing our resources.' Multiple signals indicate integration challenges with systems like Lever, Paylocity, and RingCentral. The client has expressed interest in consolidating systems and reducing manual work, with Bellamy stating they're 'trying to move it to Salesforce' and want to 'tie every single one of our back end office functions into one environment.', Multiple signals indicate a strong need for HR and talent acquisition analytics. The client is building department dashboards for HR and TA with specific requirements for tracking employee turnover, reasons for termination, and hiring metrics. Bea (HR) stated 'I want it by region. I want it by title. I want it by reason why they're leaving voluntary versus involuntary.' Kevin (head of TA) needs 'real time data that he needs to understand different hiring needs.' The client has identified Lever and Paylocity as key data sources for these metrics, making them ideal candidates for a comprehensive HR data product., The client is actively exploring App Studio for building clinician portals and customer reports. Bellamy mentioned 'we actually went into the app studio and figured things out ourselves' but also stated 'we do have some questions like it's very elementary, you know, like things like drill downs.' The signals show they've begun self-learning but need additional enablement to maximize this feature. Benjamin identified 'stakeholder portals' as a key use case, 'primarily for the clinicians' with plans to expand to other departments. This represents a significant opportunity to increase platform adoption through proper enablement.
Call Attendees: Shane Wright, Technical Consultant, Domo; Bellamy Yoo, Director, Client; Z S, DA, Client
Call Recap: Shane and Justin from Domo, along with Z and Bellamy from 21st Century Home Health Services Inc., discussed the requirements and data sources for department dashboards, including QA compliance, intake, talent acquisition, referral handling, and HR. They agreed to start with the provided building blocks and iterate on the dashboards as needed, with plans to set up integrations with various data sources like Paylocity, Lever, and Kinzer/Wellsky, and to incorporate metrics such as open roles, employee churn, and clinician compliance.

name: Business Goal Identified

Call Attendees: Benjamin Parker, Senior Program Manager, Domo; Bea Greenwood, No Title, Client; Bellamy Yoo, Director, Client; Ankit Somani, Associate Consultant, Domo
Call Recap: Ankit and Benjamin from Domo, along with Bellamy from 21st Century Home Health Services Inc., discussed the creation of a departmental dashboard for HR, focusing on metrics such as employee retention, productivity, and turnover rates, which can be filtered by region, job title, and employment type. They also addressed the availability of data, the need for scheduled reports, and the integration of data from various sources, including Paylocity and Lever, to provide a comprehensive view of HR performance. The group agreed to extend the Monday meeting to 1.5 hours to further discuss the roadmap and dashboard requirements.

name: Umbrella Use Case Identified
summary: Employee Engagement & Workforce Productivity: The HR department needs analytics to track employee turnover rates, reasons for termination, and productivity metrics by region and job title. This aligns with the workforce productivity umbrella focused on tracking turnover risk and productivity metrics.
rationale: Bea mentioned multiple times their need to track 'turnover metric' and 'the reasons behind termination by job code and by region.' She also emphasized 'productivity metrics for individual employees' and stated 'I want it by region. I want it by title. I want it by reason why they're leaving voluntary versus involuntary.'
action_context: 1. Confirm data integration requirements from Paylocity for HR metrics. 2. Develop dashboard mockups showing turnover metrics by region, title, and reason codes. 3. Schedule follow-up session to review initial dashboard designs with Bea.

Play 1 Name:
Marketing Essentials Data Product
Start with campaign performance and upgrade to campaign planning.
Play 1 Description: Non-Billed, Complete Data Product with Implementation Setup Hours Offering: This product delivers core marketing insights focused on campaign performance metrics such as impressions, click-through rates, conversions, and return on investment. It supports marketing teams in evaluating the effectiveness of their campaigns and identifying opportunities to optimize spend and improve outcomes, while also laying the groundwork for more advanced campaign planning.
Play 2 Name:
Sales & Forecasting Data Product
Rapidly time to value with insights for your sales and accurate forecasting.
Play 2 Description: Non-Billed, Complete Data Product with Implementation Setup Hours Offering: By integrating with Salesforce, this product provides real-time visibility into sales pipelines, opportunities, and closed deals. It incorporates AI and machine learning models to generate accurate sales forecasts, allowing organizations to better allocate resources, reduce forecasting errors, and improve revenue predictability.

name: Use Case Name Identified

action_context: 1. Design turnover analysis dashboard with filters for region, title, and termination reason. 2. Include trend analysis to show patterns over time. 3. Ensure the new termination codes Bea implemented are incorporated into the dashboard.

name: Target User Identified
summary: The HR department, specifically Bea and her team, are identified as the primary users for the HR analytics dashboard. Understanding this user group is crucial for designing a dashboard that meets their specific needs for tracking employee metrics and making HR decisions.
rationale: Bellamy stated they're 'trying to build a departmental dashboard for all the departmental heads. So this will be like HR's your dashboards more than anything.' Bea confirmed this by saying 'Oh, absolutely' and then proceeded to list her requirements.
action_context: 1. Schedule user interviews with Bea's HR team to understand their specific workflows and needs. 2. Design dashboard with HR-specific terminology and metrics. 3. Consider creating role-based views for different HR team members.

Call Title: Domo <> HR: Departmental Dashboard/Analytics Requirement Gathering
Call Attendees: Benjamin Parker, Senior Program Manager, Domo; Bea Greenwood, No Title, Client; Bellamy Yoo, Director, Client; Ankit Somani, Associate Consultant, Domo
Call Recap: Ankit and Benjamin from Domo, along with Bellamy from 21st Century Home Health Services Inc., discussed the creation of a departmental dashboard for HR, focusing on metrics such as employee retention, productivity, and turnover rates, which can be filtered by region, job title, and employment type. They also addressed the availability of data, the need for scheduled reports, and the integration of data from various sources, including Paylocity and Lever, to provide a comprehensive view of HR performance. The group agreed to extend the Monday meeting to 1.5 hours to further discuss the roadmap and dashboard requirements.

name: Problem Identified
summary: The HR team struggles to track termination reasons effectively due to insufficient data categorization in their current system. This prevents them from identifying specific trends and taking targeted action to address retention issues.
rationale: Bea mentioned, 'Historically mo has been putting in the termination codes and it just says resignation termination and I updated all the codes so that we can get more actual data.' This indicates they've been lacking detailed termination reasons, making trend analysis difficult.
action_context: 1. Obtain the updated termination codes Bea implemented this morning. 2. Ensure the data pipeline can capture and categorize these new codes properly. 3. Design visualizations that highlight patterns in the more granular termination reasons.

name: Business Value Statement Identified
summary: The HR analytics dashboard will enable the team to identify problematic areas with high turnover or low productivity, allowing for targeted interventions. This will help improve employee retention and operational efficiency across the organization.
rationale: Bea stated, 'so that I can start to track those trends more appropriately' regarding turnover data, and mentioned needing to know 'which one of my areas is the most troublesome' regarding past due charts, indicating the business value of identifying problem areas.
action_context: 1. Highlight this business value when presenting dashboard designs to stakeholders. 2. Include trend analysis features that make it easy to spot problematic areas. 3. Consider adding benchmark comparisons between regions/teams to better highlight outliers.

name: Feature Gap / Request
summary: The ability to filter productivity data by employment type was identified as a desired feature that may not currently exist. This filtering capability is important for HR to analyze performance differences between different employee categories.
rationale: Bea specifically requested, 'I would like to be able in the future to slice certain productivity data by employment type. I know that's always been a conversation that comes up but I don't think that's a dashboard thing that's just more data.' Bellamy responded that it's 'a filter thing' they can implement.
action_context: 1. Confirm the employment type data is available in the source systems. 2. Implement filtering capability by employment type in the productivity dashboards. 3. Validate with Bea that the implemented filters meet her requirements.

The group prioritized the department dashboards and PDF schedule report as the top priorities, with the clinician portal and AI agent being longer-term initiatives. They also discussed the timeline for these use cases, with the goal of having the department dashboards and PDF schedule report completed by mid-late August, the clinician portal by early September, the concierge workflow by early October, and the AI agent by the end of the year.

AI Account Signal Context: Implement Architecture Assessment and Optimization for Multiple System Integration, Implement HR & Talent Acquisition Data Product for Employee Analytics, Provide App Studio Training and Enablement for Portal Development
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: The client is struggling with inefficient workflows due to manual data transfers between multiple systems (Monday.com, Carestitch, Kinzer, Snowflake, etc.). Inna explicitly stated 'we just copy information from one program and entering to another, just manually, which actually not very optimal' and 'we're losing our resources.' Multiple signals indicate integration challenges with systems like Lever, Paylocity, and RingCentral. The client has expressed interest in consolidating systems and reducing manual work, with Bellamy stating they're 'trying to move it to Salesforce' and want to 'tie every single one of our back end office functions into one environment.', Multiple signals indicate a strong need for HR and talent acquisition analytics. The client is building department dashboards for HR and TA with specific requirements for tracking employee turnover, reasons for termination, and hiring metrics. Bea (HR) stated 'I want it by region. I want it by title. I want it by reason why they're leaving voluntary versus involuntary.' Kevin (head of TA) needs 'real time data that he needs to understand different hiring needs.' The client has identified Lever and Paylocity as key data sources for these metrics, making them ideal candidates for a comprehensive HR data product., The client is actively exploring App Studio for building clinician portals and customer reports. Bellamy mentioned 'we actually went into the app studio and figured things out ourselves' but also stated 'we do have some questions like it's very elementary, you know, like things like drill downs.' The signals show they've begun self-learning but need additional enablement to maximize this feature. Benjamin identified 'stakeholder portals' as a key use case, 'primarily for the clinicians' with plans to expand to other departments. This represents a significant opportunity to increase platform adoption through proper enablement.

Call Attendees: Benjamin Parker, Senior Program Manager, Domo; Bellamy Yoo, Director, Client; Ankit Somani, Associate Consultant, Domo; Shane Wright, Technical Consultant, Domo
Call Recap: Benjamin, Ankit, Shane and Vince from Domo, along with Bellamy, Z and Inna from 21st Century Home Health Services Inc., discussed the roadmap for implementing various use cases on the Domo platform, including department dashboards, a PDF schedule report, a clinician portal with AI capabilities, and a concierge workflow. The group prioritized the department dashboards and PDF schedule report as the top priorities, with the clinician portal and AI agent being longer-term initiatives. They also discussed the timeline for these use cases, with the goal of having the department dashboards and PDF schedule report completed by mid-late August, the clinician portal by early September, the concierge workflow by early October, and the AI agent by the end of the year.

name: Feature Gap / Request
summary: The client has requested geolocation analytics capabilities based on addresses rather than just zip codes, which may require additional configuration or features. This functionality is critical for both their department dashboards and executive reporting needs.
rationale: Bellamy stated: 'I want to understand how to generate those map views... I want to do address based to be honest' and mentioned this would feed into 'executive and Ta HR dashboards because we need geoanalytical, geoanalytics for that.' This indicates a specific feature need around address-based mapping.
action_context: 1. Evaluate Domo's current geolocation capabilities for address-level mapping. 2. Prepare documentation or training on how to implement address-based mapping in Domo. 3. Consider if any additional tools or connectors are needed for this functionality.

name: Data Distribution Identified
summary: The client needs to distribute reports to external hospital clients, requiring PDF generation capabilities. This external data sharing requirement will impact how dashboards are designed and how the distribution workflow is configured.
rationale: Bellamy mentioned: 'we have a lot of the data or cards ready for the schedule report, one pager... I want to know if there's a way that's going to organize these cards in a clean way to be able to produce PDFS so that we can send it to our clients or hospital clients.' This clearly indicates an external data distribution need.
action_context: 1. Review Domo's PDF export and scheduling capabilities with the client. 2. Discuss design considerations for reports intended for external distribution. 3. Evaluate if Domo Everywhere might be appropriate for their external sharing needs.

Play 1 Name:
Marketing Essentials Data Product
Start with campaign performance and upgrade to campaign planning.
Play 1 Description: Non-Billed, Complete Data Product with Implementation Setup Hours Offering: This product delivers core marketing insights focused on campaign performance metrics such as impressions, click-through rates, conversions, and return on investment. It supports marketing teams in evaluating the effectiveness of their campaigns and identifying opportunities to optimize spend and improve outcomes, while also laying the groundwork for more advanced campaign planning.
Play 2 Name:
Sales & Forecasting Data Product
Rapidly time to value with insights for your sales and accurate forecasting.
Play 2 Description: Non-Billed, Complete Data Product with Implementation Setup Hours Offering: By integrating with Salesforce, this product provides real-time visibility into sales pipelines, opportunities, and closed deals. It incorporates AI and machine learning models to generate accurate sales forecasts, allowing organizations to better allocate resources, reduce forecasting errors, and improve revenue predictability.

summary: The team is exploring AI chat capabilities, having met with Roger and Robbie's team about a chat use case. This external integration represents an opportunity to enhance the platform's functionality and user experience through conversational AI.
rationale: Casey mentioned at the end: 'we did meet with that team with Roger and Robbie's team about the chat use case,' indicating discussions about integrating chat functionality.
action_context: 1. Follow up on the chat use case discussion to clarify requirements and next steps. 2. Determine if additional resources or expertise are needed for the chat integration. 3. Document the use case details to ensure alignment across teams.

AI Account Signal Context: Schedule Domo Architecture Assessment to address sandbox-to-production migration issues, Schedule AI Agents & Readiness assessment for on-time delivery prediction use case, Implement a Financial Planning Data Product for the international forecasting project
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: Multiple signals indicate recurring issues with sandbox-to-production migrations, particularly with partitioned datasets, variable controls, and app promotions. Raymond is 'constantly reaching out' for access to datasets created in the virtual machine. There are specific errors when promoting cards from UAT to production, with Mamta noting 'we are not fully supporting partition via sandbox' and recommending building in prod directly. These architectural limitations are causing workflow bottlenecks and preventing efficient deployment of critical dashboards, including healthcare reporting., UPS is exploring AI capabilities within Domo, with specific interest in forecasting and predicting on-time deliveries for their international air freight operations. Parsa confirmed this would be valuable: 'It is definitely a good proactive type of thing that would tell us, hey, these shipments are at risk and it could help us to save and improve our time in transit.' Raveendra has already submitted an AI use case for review through UPS's AI governance team. The team is also interested in AI chat capabilities, auto summarization, insights generation, and auto content building. They're considering integration with multiple AI models including Google Gemini, OpenAI via Azure, and Databricks., Multiple signals show UPS is working on a financial forecasting project that requires Domo integration with Google BigQuery. Regina shared her current manual process of creating daily, weekly, and monthly forecasts for leadership using screen scrapes from websites. The team is waiting for BigQuery access credentials to begin implementation. They have a 'wish list' of metrics including volume and revenue by day, region, product, customer, and revenue-specific items like discounts and fuel surcharges. This represents a significant opportunity to replace manual processes with automated reporting and provide leadership with more comprehensive forecasting capabilities.

Call Title: UPS + Domo: Bi-Weekly Status Sync & Technical Office Hours
Call Attendees: Kevin Wilck, Manager Strategic Accounts, Domo; Shelly Valdez, Industrial Engineering Manager, Client; Casey Dorman, No Title, Domo; Scott Thompson, Consultant, Domo; Braxton Fullenkamp, No Title, Domo; William Stone, Manager, Global Ocean Product, Client; Raymond Alvarez-Torre, Supervisor, Data Management, Client; Ashok Immadisetti, Director, Application Development, Client; Horacio Pina, Director of Information Systems, Client; Parsa Naraghi, Director, Global ASC Coordinator, Global Freight Forwarding, Client
Call Recap: Scott, Casey, Kevin and Braxton from Domo, along with Horacio, Parsa, Noman, Raymond, Shelly, William Stone, Colette, Boobasgupta and Ashok, discussed various updates and issues, including a dated Domo brick app that needed to be redeployed, a request for a specified number of adopters for supplier management subscriptions, and an issue with new cards or notebooks not appearing in the production app after deployment. The team also discussed the status of AI and security reviews, leveraging Domo's AI capabilities, and the enterprise workbench migration. Parsa and Scott worked together to troubleshoot an issue with a "cold chain dashboard" that was not updating as expected, identifying a problem with the data type in a Python script.

name: Umbrella Use Case Identified
summary: Workflow Automation & Operational Efficiency: The team is working on implementing an AI use case for CI (Continuous Improvement) that requires security review completion. This represents an opportunity to showcase Domo's AI capabilities for process automation and operational improvements.

action_context: 1. Follow up on the legal/security review completion status. 2. Prepare for POC instance setup once approvals are received. 3. Coordinate with Ravi's team to define success metrics for the CI use case implementation.

Play 1 Name: AI Agents & Readiness - Seamless AI integration with targeted assessments and strategies.
Play 1 Description: Non-Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: supports organizations in preparing for and deploying AI use cases in Domo. This includes evaluating your current data landscape, identifying AI-ready use cases, recommending ML tools or integrations (such as Domo’s AI Service Layer or 3rd party connectors), and developing governance around AI usage. The goal is to enable intelligent automation, predictive insights, and human-AI collaboration through a controlled, value-driven approach.
Play 2 Name: AI Agents & Readiness - Seamless AI integration with targeted assessments and strategies.
Play 2 Description: Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: supports organizations in preparing for and deploying AI use cases in Domo. This includes evaluating your current data landscape, identifying AI-ready use cases, recommending ML tools or integrations (such as Domo’s AI Service Layer or 3rd party connectors), and developing governance around AI usage. The goal is to enable intelligent automation, predictive insights, and human-AI collaboration through a controlled, value-driven approach.

account_name: United Parcel Service Oasis Supply Corporation
name: Feature Gap / Request
summary: Raymond identified an issue with the app promotion process where cards created in UAT and pushed to production don't appear in the app automatically, requiring manual intervention. This feature gap impacts workflow efficiency for the Symphony team and requires technical investigation.
rationale: Raymond stated: 'I'll create in the apps in uat… a new card or a new notebook, and after pushing to production, the card will get created, but it will not appear in the app. So I have to actually find it manually.' Braxton acknowledged this as an issue and suggested looking at logs and submitting a ticket to engineering.
action_context: 1. Submit a ticket to engineering as Braxton suggested to investigate the app promotion issue. 2. Check sandbox logs for layout errors during promotion process. 3. Consider documenting a workaround for the team until the issue is resolved.

Call Recap: Scott, Casey, Kevin and Braxton from Domo, along with Horacio, Parsa, Noman, Raymond, Shelly, William Stone, Colette, Boobasgupta and Ashok, discussed various updates and issues, including a dated Domo brick app that needed to be redeployed, a request for a specified number of adopters for supplier management subscriptions, and an issue with new cards or notebooks not appearing in the production app after deployment. Play 1 Name:
Finance Advanced Data Product
Start with campaign performance and upgrade to campaign planning.
Play 1 Description: Non-Billed , Complete Data Product with Implementation Setup Hours Offering: This comprehensive financial solution combines advanced analytics across revenue, profitability, expenses, and cash flow. It enables organizations to analyze financial performance by product, region, customer, or sales channel and supports cost optimization through detailed expense tracking. Accounts receivable and payable modules help improve working capital management, while real-time cash flow monitoring enhances liquidity planning. Additional features include scenario modeling, compliance monitoring, internal controls, and capital investment analysis, making this product ideal for finance leaders driving both operational efficiency and strategic growth.
Play 2 Name:
Finance Essentials Data Product
Get your finance team started with critical insights and reporting
Play 2 Description: Non-Billed, Complete Data Product with Implementation Setup Hours Offering: This solution provides foundational financial reporting tools, including profit and loss statements, balance sheets, and executive dashboards. It enables finance teams to quickly evaluate the financial health of the organization, monitor key performance indicators, and deliver timely, accurate insights to business leaders for strategic decision-making.

name: Architecture Gap Identified
summary: The team identified a data access gap where Domo currently lacks connectivity to the required BigQuery tables. This is blocking development progress for the forecasting POC and requires either service account credentials or alternative data delivery methods.
rationale: When Kevin H asks, 'So, you guys still, do you have access to those to that data set or not?' Kevin W responds, 'No, we don't have access to any data.' Braxton later explains they're 'in a holding pattern' without this data access.
action_context: 1. Pursue three-tiered approach to data access: service account credentials (best), flat file exports (better), or sample data (minimum). 2. Engage UPS security team to expedite service account approval. 3. Prepare data transformation plan once access is granted.

AI Account Signal Context: Schedule Domo Architecture Assessment to address sandbox-to-production migration issues, Schedule AI Agents & Readiness assessment for on-time delivery prediction use case, Implement a Financial Planning Data Product for the international forecasting project
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: Multiple signals indicate recurring issues with sandbox-to-production migrations, particularly with partitioned datasets, variable controls, and app promotions. Raymond is 'constantly reaching out' for access to datasets created in the virtual machine. There are specific errors when promoting cards from UAT to production, with Mamta noting 'we are not fully supporting partition via sandbox' and recommending building in prod directly. These architectural limitations are causing workflow bottlenecks and preventing efficient deployment of critical dashboards, including healthcare reporting., UPS is exploring AI capabilities within Domo, with specific interest in forecasting and predicting on-time deliveries for their international air freight operations. Parsa confirmed this would be valuable: 'It is definitely a good proactive type of thing that would tell us, hey, these shipments are at risk and it could help us to save and improve our time in transit.' Raveendra has already submitted an AI use case for review through UPS's AI governance team. The team is also interested in AI chat capabilities, auto summarization, insights generation, and auto content building. They're considering integration with multiple AI models including Google Gemini, OpenAI via Azure, and Databricks., Multiple signals show UPS is working on a financial forecasting project that requires Domo integration with Google BigQuery. Regina shared her current manual process of creating daily, weekly, and monthly forecasts for leadership using screen scrapes from websites. The team is waiting for BigQuery access credentials to begin implementation. They have a 'wish list' of metrics including volume and revenue by day, region, product, customer, and revenue-specific items like discounts and fuel surcharges. This represents a significant opportunity to replace manual processes with automated reporting and provide leadership with more comprehensive forecasting capabilities.

Call Title: Domo Data Access for UPS ISPK Forecasting Project
Call Attendees: Kevin Wilck, Manager Strategic Accounts, Domo; Jace McLean, No Title, Domo; Braxton Fullenkamp, No Title, Domo; Kevin Hamada, Director, Systems Development, Client; Ford Hebner, No Title, Client; Manish Patel, Individual Contributor, Client
Call Recap: Braxton, Kevin Wilck and Jace from Domo, along with Kevin Hamada, Manish and Ford from United Parcel Service Oasis Supply Corporation, discussed the process of accessing data from Google BigQuery to develop a proof of concept for international forecasting. The key points were the need to secure service account access or receive data extracts, the potential integration options between Domo and Google Cloud Platform, and the urgency to schedule a meeting to move the project forward, as the email discussions had started in March.

AI Account Signal Context: Schedule a technical session focused on App Studio and workflow permissions issues with a product expert, Implement a knowledge transfer plan to build additional Domo expertise beyond Dale Whitchurch, Develop a merger/acquisition support plan to ensure continuity of Domo projects
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: Multiple signals indicate that Dale Whitchurch (identified champion) is experiencing significant technical challenges with App Studio, workflow permissions, and filter context persistence. These issues are causing frustration and potential risk to the relationship. Dale has been described as 'an amazing champion' who 'uses every piece of our platform' but is hitting limitations that require specialized technical support. The tone has shifted negatively with Dale expressing that it's 'getting really frustrating' and they're 'kind of guessing on our own' despite flagging issues 'early in the year.', Signals indicate Dale Whitchurch is the sole technical expert for Domo within IPG Health, creating a potential knowledge gap and single point of failure. Michael noted 'his skill set is so high that there's not really anyone else, in his orbit that has, the capabilities...to understand what Dale's trying to do and help him figure it out.' With the complex implementation involving App Studio, Workflows, and Code Engine across multiple instances, and with upcoming releases affecting nearly 1,000 users, this dependency creates significant risk., Multiple signals indicate IPG Health is undergoing an acquisition by Omnicom (announced in December), creating urgency to complete numerous Domo projects. Lizzie mentioned they're 'in the middle of an acquisition' which has impacted their FP&A system implementation plans. Michael stated there's 'a big push on the ipg side to get a lot of these projects through the door' due to the acquisition. This represents both a risk and opportunity for the Domo relationship during this transition period.

Call Attendees: Michael Napoli, No Title, Domo; Douglas DZio, Direct of Project Management, Client; Jesse Wolfson, Partner AE, Domo; William Dubois, No Title, Domo
Call Recap: John, Michael, Jesse and William from Domo, along with Douglas from IPG Health, LLC, discussed the delivery timeline and pricing for a project, with Domo providing an overview of the MVP (Minimum Viable Product) and beta deliverables, as well as the training plan and collateral. The group also addressed concerns about the tight budget and explored potential pricing adjustments, ultimately agreeing that the current pricing seemed palatable and an opportunity to market the speaker bureau service more actively.

AI Account Signal Context: Implement Architecture Assessment and Optimization for Multiple System Integration, Implement HR & Talent Acquisition Data Product for Employee Analytics, Provide App Studio Training and Enablement for Portal Development
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: The client is struggling with inefficient workflows due to manual data transfers between multiple systems (Monday.com, Carestitch, Kinzer, Snowflake, etc.). Inna explicitly stated 'we just copy information from one program and entering to another, just manually, which actually not very optimal' and 'we're losing our resources.' Multiple signals indicate integration challenges with systems like Lever, Paylocity, and RingCentral. The client has expressed interest in consolidating systems and reducing manual work, with Bellamy stating they're 'trying to move it to Salesforce' and want to 'tie every single one of our back end office functions into one environment.', Multiple signals indicate a strong need for HR and talent acquisition analytics. The client is building department dashboards for HR and TA with specific requirements for tracking employee turnover, reasons for termination, and hiring metrics. Bea (HR) stated 'I want it by region. I want it by title. I want it by reason why they're leaving voluntary versus involuntary.' Kevin (head of TA) needs 'real time data that he needs to understand different hiring needs.' The client has identified Lever and Paylocity as key data sources for these metrics, making them ideal candidates for a comprehensive HR data product., The client is actively exploring App Studio for building clinician portals and customer reports. Bellamy mentioned 'we actually went into the app studio and figured things out ourselves' but also stated 'we do have some questions like it's very elementary, you know, like things like drill downs.' The signals show they've begun self-learning but need additional enablement to maximize this feature. Benjamin identified 'stakeholder portals' as a key use case, 'primarily for the clinicians' with plans to expand to other departments. This represents a significant opportunity to increase platform adoption through proper enablement.

name: Business Goal Identified
summary: The customer needs to support global users across time zones, particularly in Asia Pacific (APAC), by adjusting their data refresh schedules. This indicates a business goal of improving global data accessibility and decision-making.
rationale: Raymond mentions: 'We do want to accommodate for like asiapac, like APAC' and 'We can run the refresh at say six o'clock pacific, which would be two o'clock UTC, two am UTC. And that's fine for APAC, right? If we refresh it at say two am because now they're getting, you know, some fresh data.'
action_context: 1. Discuss global data strategy and how to optimize for users across different time zones. 2. Provide best practices for refresh schedules that balance global access needs with system performance. 3. Consider if additional data governance or access controls are needed for global usage.

AI Account Signal Context: Schedule Domo Architecture Assessment to address sandbox-to-production migration issues, Schedule AI Agents & Readiness assessment for on-time delivery prediction use case, Implement a Financial Planning Data Product for the international forecasting project
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: Multiple signals indicate recurring issues with sandbox-to-production migrations, particularly with partitioned datasets, variable controls, and app promotions. Raymond is 'constantly reaching out' for access to datasets created in the virtual machine. There are specific errors when promoting cards from UAT to production, with Mamta noting 'we are not fully supporting partition via sandbox' and recommending building in prod directly. These architectural limitations are causing workflow bottlenecks and preventing efficient deployment of critical dashboards, including healthcare reporting., UPS is exploring AI capabilities within Domo, with specific interest in forecasting and predicting on-time deliveries for their international air freight operations. Parsa confirmed this would be valuable: 'It is definitely a good proactive type of thing that would tell us, hey, these shipments are at risk and it could help us to save and improve our time in transit.' Raveendra has already submitted an AI use case for review through UPS's AI governance team. The team is also interested in AI chat capabilities, auto summarization, insights generation, and auto content building. They're considering integration with multiple AI models including Google Gemini, OpenAI via Azure, and Databricks., Multiple signals show UPS is working on a financial forecasting project that requires Domo integration with Google BigQuery. Regina shared her current manual process of creating daily, weekly, and monthly forecasts for leadership using screen scrapes from websites. The team is waiting for BigQuery access credentials to begin implementation. They have a 'wish list' of metrics including volume and revenue by day, region, product, customer, and revenue-specific items like discounts and fuel surcharges. This represents a significant opportunity to replace manual processes with automated reporting and provide leadership with more comprehensive forecasting capabilities.

Call Recap: Brian and Mamta from Domo, along with Raymond from United Parcel Service Oasis Supply Corporation, discussed an issue with a "Trends" card displaying volume data for the current year, including weeks that had not occurred yet, due to a time zone discrepancy between the data source and the Domo settings. They collaborated to find a solution, with Mamta suggesting the use of a "run date" field instead of the current date to ensure the data shown is for the correct day, and Raymond agreeing to implement the necessary changes in a new "beast mode" to address the issue.

account_name: United Parcel Service Oasis Supply Corporation
name: Feature Gap / Request
summary: The customer is experiencing issues with UTC time zone handling in their dashboard data, which is causing future data to appear prematurely in their trends card. This timing issue affects data visualization accuracy and requires a workaround using beast modes.
rationale: Raymond explains they're having trouble with UTC time conversion causing future shipment data to appear in their reports too early. He states: 'At eight o'clock Eastern Time, it's midnight UTC... What that does is it brings in the volume for the next day, and we didn't want that.' He's implemented a beast mode workaround but is seeking validation on his approach to handle the UTC timing issue.
action_context: 1. Validate the customer's beast mode solution for handling UTC time conversion. 2. Explore if there are better approaches to manage time zone differences in their dashboards. 3. Consider if this is a common enough issue to suggest as a feature enhancement to the product team.

name: External Event Identified
summary: IPG is preparing for an upcoming merger which is driving urgency around data collection through forms. This corporate event is creating timeline pressure for resolving the workflow form issues.
rationale: Sabrina mentioned: 'a lot of our presidents need to fill out their commentary for, you know, the next re. So they just want to be, you know, able to show off their commentary and presentations and stuff especially with the merger coming soon. They want to have everything ready.'
action_context: 1. Prioritize resolution of the workflow form issues given the merger timeline. 2. Understand the specific merger timeline to align support efforts. 3. Consider offering additional resources to ensure data collection needs are met before the merger.

This service includes stakeholder alignment sessions, prioritization of initiatives, and a detailed roadmap covering quick wins and long-term goals. It ensures data, governance, and solution development are aligned with enterprise objectives, helping clients move from ad hoc reporting to scalable, value-driven insights across the organization.

name: Feature Gap / Request
summary: IPG identified a critical bug in Domo's workflow forms where paragraph text entries with line breaks are not being properly captured. This functionality gap is blocking important business processes related to commentary collection for upcoming presentations.
rationale: Sabrina explicitly described the issue: 'when it is a paragraph form, short answer... the users can't type paragraphs if that makes sense. So, if they for example, type like, hi, and then enter and then write more... like commentary below that, it doesn't register the rest.' She confirmed this has been submitted as a support ticket and emphasized the urgency of fixing it.
action_context: 1. Ensure the support ticket is properly escalated to engineering. 2. Provide a timeline for resolution to the customer. 3. Consider suggesting a temporary workaround until the bug is fixed.

name: Feature Gap / Request
summary: IPG identified a permissions issue in Domo workflows where users need to be individually assigned permissions to execute workflows rather than having permissions automatically granted to form users. This creates administrative overhead and blocks efficient workflow implementation.
rationale: Sabrina stated: 'We were wondering if it's possible to like when we create a form through a workflow, anyone who lands on the site for the form can have access to all the permissions automatically to execute the workflow.' Karl added that this should be default functionality since workflows often need to 'execute at a higher function like high level functions than the submitter.'
action_context: 1. Consult with the App Studio/Workflows team about this permissions enhancement request. 2. Determine if there are existing workarounds or best practices. 3. Provide feedback to IPG on feasibility and timeline.

name: Umbrella Use Case Identified
summary: Financial Planning, Budgeting & Reporting: Trevor mentioned they're preparing for Q4 by running different pricing scenarios to analyze impacts on revenue, inventory, and profitability. This financial planning use case involves forecasting and analyzing how price changes will affect key financial metrics.
rationale: Trevor stated they're 'getting ready for Q4' and 'running through some different scenarios' to ensure inventory is prepared. He specifically mentioned analyzing the impact of price changes on 'revenue inventory, all that good stuff' and that 'profitability models live in Domo' to help make data-driven decisions about pricing.
action_context: 1. Schedule a follow-up session focused specifically on financial planning and pricing analysis use cases. 2. Explore how Domo's forecasting and scenario planning capabilities could enhance their current process. 3. Consider recommending best practices for financial modeling in Domo that could improve their pricing analysis workflow.
recommended_action: Implement Finance Advanced Data Product to enhance financial planning and pricing optimization
signal_rationale: The signals show Cozy Earth is heavily focused on financial planning, pricing optimization, and profit maximization. They're running pricing scenarios to analyze impacts on revenue, inventory, and profitability (signal 924be799). They're using Domo to determine optimal pricing strategies that balance revenue growth with maintaining acceptable profit margins (signal 0b6e8caf). Their business goal is explicitly to maximize profit dollars through optimized pricing (signal 04d31db9). The Finance Advanced Data Product would provide comprehensive financial analytics across revenue, profitability, expenses, and cash flow, with scenario modeling capabilities that directly address their current use cases.
Play 1 Name:
Finance Advanced Data Product
Start with campaign performance and upgrade to campaign planning.
Play 1 Description: Non-Billed , Complete Data Product with Implementation Setup Hours Offering: This comprehensive financial solution combines advanced analytics across revenue, profitability, expenses, and cash flow. It enables organizations to analyze financial performance by product, region, customer, or sales channel and supports cost optimization through detailed expense tracking. Accounts receivable and payable modules help improve working capital management, while real-time cash flow monitoring enhances liquidity planning. Additional features include scenario modeling, compliance monitoring, internal controls, and capital investment analysis, making this product ideal for finance leaders driving both operational efficiency and strategic growth.

The group also discussed the upcoming Domo Connections Tour event in Salt Lake City, which Trevor expressed interest in attending to connect with Domo representatives and learn more about the platform's features.

name: Problem Identified
summary: The customer is working on optimizing pricing on their website to maximize profit dollars. They're using Domo to analyze the results of price tests to determine the optimal pricing strategy that balances revenue growth with maintaining acceptable profit margins.
rationale: Trevor mentioned they're 'doing a lot of price changing on our website, just trying to find more optimal pricing' and ran 'a price test to try to see what the lift would be if we lowered pricing 10 percent, 20 percent.' He explained they analyze 'what does profitability look like? What does gross margin look like?' to determine 'which one at the end of the day maximizes profit dollars.'
action_context: 1. Explore how Domo's advanced analytics capabilities could help further optimize their pricing strategy. 2. Recommend visualizations or dashboards specifically designed for pricing analysis and profit optimization. 3. name: Business Goal Identified
summary: The customer is focused on maximizing profit dollars through optimized pricing strategies. They're using Domo to analyze how different price points affect profitability and gross margins to make data-driven decisions about pricing on their website.
rationale: Trevor explained they're running price tests to see 'what the lift would be if we lowered pricing 10 percent, 20 percent' and analyzing 'what does profitability look like? What does gross margin look like?' to determine 'which one at the end of the day maximizes profit dollars.' This clearly indicates a business goal of profit optimization through strategic pricing.
action_context: 1. Align future Domo solutions and recommendations with their profit maximization goal. 2. Share case studies or examples of how other companies have used Domo to optimize pricing and profitability. 3. Consider suggesting advanced analytics or ML capabilities that could further enhance their ability to predict optimal pricing points.

name: External Integration
summary: Trevor mentioned they're integrating data from another platform that handles price testing with Domo for profitability analysis. This integration is critical for their pricing optimization workflow and demonstrates how they're connecting external systems with Domo for business decision-making.
rationale: Trevor stated 'we have another platform that kind of does that on the front end. And then we get the data from that and we'll look at based off the orders within each group' and that they 'utilize Domo in that way, to kind of combine the information from this other platform with what's sitting in Domo' to make data-driven decisions.
action_context: 1. Review the current integration setup to ensure it's optimized for efficiency and data accuracy. 2. Explore if there are opportunities to automate or streamline the data flow between the external platform and Domo. 3. Consider whether additional external data sources could enhance their pricing analysis capabilities.
recommended_action: Conduct Domo Pipeline Optimization to improve their data integration and ETL processes
signal_rationale: Trevor mentioned they're using Domo as their data warehouse with all their data feeding into Domo and all pipelines built within Domo (signal 099f942a). They're also integrating data from another platform that handles price testing with Domo for profitability analysis (signal 51795cf7). Given their heavy reliance on Domo for data warehousing and ETL, optimizing their data pipelines would improve performance, reliability, and scalability. The Pipeline Optimization would audit ETL logic, identify inefficiencies, remove redundant datasets, and implement best practices for scheduling and resource usage.
Play 1 Description: Non-Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: ocuses on streamlining your data ingestion and transformation processes. It includes auditing ETL logic, identifying inefficiencies in recursive or chained dataflows, removing redundant datasets, and implementing best practices for scheduling and resource usage. The result is faster, more reliable data pipelines that scale with business growth.

account_name: United Parcel Service Oasis Supply Corporation
name: Feature Gap / Request
summary: The customer is concerned about AI credit consumption and wants to limit how users can access the AI functionality to prevent unnecessary credit usage. They need a way to restrict AI access and control what types of questions users can ask.
rationale: Shelly expressed concern about users burning credits by asking questions that could be answered through dashboard filters, stating 'I would hate for somebody to go to AI and say, give me all the shipment details for X shipment, right? And burn a whole bunch of credits when we can just add a filter for them to look up the shipment number.' She specifically asked 'Is there a way to limit the AI?' showing a need for access control features.
action_context: 1. Provide detailed information on AI access control capabilities. 2. Schedule a focused session with Braxton to explore AI governance options. 3. Discuss AI credit consumption in future contract negotiations.

AI Account Signal Context: Schedule Domo Architecture Assessment to address sandbox-to-production migration issues, Schedule AI Agents & Readiness assessment for on-time delivery prediction use case, Implement a Financial Planning Data Product for the international forecasting project
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: Multiple signals indicate recurring issues with sandbox-to-production migrations, particularly with partitioned datasets, variable controls, and app promotions. Raymond is 'constantly reaching out' for access to datasets created in the virtual machine. There are specific errors when promoting cards from UAT to production, with Mamta noting 'we are not fully supporting partition via sandbox' and recommending building in prod directly. These architectural limitations are causing workflow bottlenecks and preventing efficient deployment of critical dashboards, including healthcare reporting., UPS is exploring AI capabilities within Domo, with specific interest in forecasting and predicting on-time deliveries for their international air freight operations. Parsa confirmed this would be valuable: 'It is definitely a good proactive type of thing that would tell us, hey, these shipments are at risk and it could help us to save and improve our time in transit.' Raveendra has already submitted an AI use case for review through UPS's AI governance team. The team is also interested in AI chat capabilities, auto summarization, insights generation, and auto content building. They're considering integration with multiple AI models including Google Gemini, OpenAI via Azure, and Databricks., Multiple signals show UPS is working on a financial forecasting project that requires Domo integration with Google BigQuery. Regina shared her current manual process of creating daily, weekly, and monthly forecasts for leadership using screen scrapes from websites. The team is waiting for BigQuery access credentials to begin implementation. They have a 'wish list' of metrics including volume and revenue by day, region, product, customer, and revenue-specific items like discounts and fuel surcharges. This represents a significant opportunity to replace manual processes with automated reporting and provide leadership with more comprehensive forecasting capabilities.

Call Recap: Domo team members discussed concerns about credit consumption for the AI functionality, with Shelly and Kevin exploring ways to limit access and control costs. Additionally, the team addressed an issue with a variable card filter that caused conflicts when promoting changes from UAT to production, which was ultimately resolved. The main focus of the call was on the significant work required to integrate the IAF and NAF reporting systems into a single, unified view.

account_name: United Parcel Service Oasis Supply Corporation
name: Sandbox Migration Identified
summary: The customer is actively working with sandbox-to-production migrations and experiencing specific issues with variable control cards during promotion. This indicates active development work requiring sandbox-to-production workflows.
rationale: Multiple references to UAT-to-production promotion were made throughout the call. Raymond mentioned 'when I promoted from uat' and described the process of removing elements from production and then promoting from UAT again to resolve issues. Brian also referenced past issues when trying to 'push from dev to prod control.'
action_context: 1. Provide best practices documentation for sandbox-to-production migrations. 2. Schedule a technical review of their promotion workflow. 3. Monitor future promotions to ensure the workaround remains effective until a permanent fix is implemented.

account_name: United Parcel Service Oasis Supply Corporation
name: Architecture Gap Identified
summary: A technical issue was identified where variable control cards don't properly promote from UAT to production environment, causing promotion errors. This architectural gap in the sandbox-to-production workflow is disrupting their development process.
rationale: Raymond described a specific issue: 'when I promoted from uat, it created this weird block where it says, well, prod is designed this way and you're trying to promote from uat where it's this other way. And instead of it overwriting what was in prod, it just gave that error and it wouldn't take what we did in uat and apply it to prod.' This indicates a structural weakness in the promotion path for variable control cards.
action_context: 1. Create a support ticket to address the variable control promotion issue. 2. Document the current workaround (removing the control from prod before promoting). 3. Follow up with engineering to ensure this architectural gap is resolved.

name: Business Goal Identified
summary: The customer views the Domo solution as a strategic differentiator that, while generating modest direct revenue, serves as a catalyst for pulling through much larger revenue streams. This positions the solution as a critical business driver despite its smaller direct contribution.
rationale: Dale stated: 'it's kind of one of those pull through revenue things and a necessary evil type of thing. You have to have it because people want it... having it is a differentiator in the game and something that while its revenue contribution is small, it pulls through a much larger revenue stream.' This clearly articulates the strategic business value beyond direct revenue.
action_context: 1. Develop ROI metrics that capture both direct and indirect revenue impact. 2. Create case studies highlighting the 'pull through' value to share with leadership. 3. Align solution development to enhance the differentiating aspects that drive larger revenue streams.

AI Account Signal Context: Schedule a technical session focused on App Studio and workflow permissions issues with a product expert, Implement a knowledge transfer plan to build additional Domo expertise beyond Dale Whitchurch, Develop a merger/acquisition support plan to ensure continuity of Domo projects
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: Multiple signals indicate that Dale Whitchurch (identified champion) is experiencing significant technical challenges with App Studio, workflow permissions, and filter context persistence. These issues are causing frustration and potential risk to the relationship. Dale has been described as 'an amazing champion' who 'uses every piece of our platform' but is hitting limitations that require specialized technical support. The tone has shifted negatively with Dale expressing that it's 'getting really frustrating' and they're 'kind of guessing on our own' despite flagging issues 'early in the year.', Signals indicate Dale Whitchurch is the sole technical expert for Domo within IPG Health, creating a potential knowledge gap and single point of failure. Michael noted 'his skill set is so high that there's not really anyone else, in his orbit that has, the capabilities...to understand what Dale's trying to do and help him figure it out.' With the complex implementation involving App Studio, Workflows, and Code Engine across multiple instances, and with upcoming releases affecting nearly 1,000 users, this dependency creates significant risk., Multiple signals indicate IPG Health is undergoing an acquisition by Omnicom (announced in December), creating urgency to complete numerous Domo projects. Lizzie mentioned they're 'in the middle of an acquisition' which has impacted their FP&A system implementation plans. Michael stated there's 'a big push on the ipg side to get a lot of these projects through the door' due to the acquisition. This represents both a risk and opportunity for the Domo relationship during this transition period.

name: Feature Gap / Request
summary: The customer is experiencing issues with Domo's notification system, which continues to send notifications despite settings to turn them off. This gap in functionality is causing workflow disruptions and frustration as the team is trying to manage tasks through a custom app.
rationale: Dale explicitly mentioned: 'So, even though we send things to a task queue and we've turned off all notifications. Domo still sends out notifications.' He further expressed frustration saying 'no good deed goes unpunished. Trying to use Domo's platforms to do things.' This indicates they've attempted to customize notification settings but the platform isn't respecting those settings.
action_context: 1. Technical team should investigate why notifications are still being sent despite settings. 2. Provide workaround options until the issue is fixed. 3. Consider this feedback for product improvements around notification management in custom apps.
