account_name: Stephen F Austin Community Health Center, Inc.
name: Tone-Shift Sentiment
summary: The customer has expressed a significant negative shift in sentiment toward Domo, explicitly stating they plan to cancel their subscription next year. After nearly two years with the platform, they feel it has been underutilized and hasn't delivered expected value.
rationale: Linh directly stated: 'we plan to cancel the subscription by next year to be honest with you' and described their account as 'almost like idol now.' She also expressed frustration with the pace of implementation: 'we didn't move too much or too fast enough as we asked for, we expect Domo to be with us.'
action_context: 1. Immediately develop a retention plan with concrete value delivery milestones. 2. Schedule a deep-dive session to understand specific expectations that weren't met. 3. Create a timeline for quick-win implementations to demonstrate immediate value.
recommended_action: Schedule an urgent Business Value Roadmap Session focused on AP automation and finance process improvements
signal_rationale: The customer has explicitly stated plans to cancel their subscription next year due to underutilization (signal REL-06). However, they've recently identified specific use cases around AP automation and finance processes that could deliver immediate value. The signals show they have 4 AP staff processing 100-200 invoices daily manually, creating a clear opportunity for automation. A Business Value Roadmap Session would help quantify the financial impact of these inefficiencies and demonstrate how Domo can address their specific pain points around manual data entry for payroll allocation, invoice processing, and bank data entry into their MIP system.
Play 1 Description: A process in which experienced consultants work directly with clients to identify, articulate and quantify the financial impacts of their analytic decisions. Example: Client needs help identifying where most loss is originating from. What other clients in the same industry are doing to avoid these loss.
Play 2 Name: Cancellation Request
Play 2 Description: Upon discovering the csutomer is saying they may cancel, or if key cancellation risks are surfaced via the risk assessment report, review what elements seem to be most related and contact the customer to discover which options will resonate best whether it's related to commercial factors vs value factors and build an approach to mitigate risk.

Call Title: Domo | Stephen F. Austin Community Health Center - Adoption Engine Kickoff
Call Attendees: Chance Ewell, No Title, Domo; Linh Tran, Director, Client; Benjamin Parker, Senior Program Manager, Domo; Ankit Somani, Associate Consultant, Domo; Shane Wright, Technical Consultant, Domo; Vince Wong, BC, Domo; Julia Conner, Senior Program Manager, Domo
Call Recap: Domo team members, along with Linh from Stephen F Austin Community Health Center, Inc., discussed the challenges Linh's organization has faced in utilizing the Domo platform effectively over the past 2 years. The Domo team proposed a plan to integrate Domo with Linh's existing systems, such as the MIP accounting software, to improve data quality and enable more meaningful dashboards and analytics, ultimately helping Linh's organization derive greater value from the Domo platform and avoid canceling their subscription.

account_name: Stephen F Austin Community Health Center, Inc.
name: Usage Shift
summary: There appears to be minimal to no usage of the Domo platform currently at Stephen F Austin Community Health Center. The customer described their account as 'almost like idol now' after nearly two years of subscription, indicating a severe drop in engagement.
rationale: Linh directly stated: 'We've been with almost two years and we haven't done anything much. I mean, our [account] almost like idol now.' This clearly indicates a significant negative shift in platform usage.
action_context: 1. Pull usage analytics to quantify the exact level of engagement. 2. Identify potential quick-win use cases that can drive immediate adoption. 3. Develop an adoption strategy with clear KPIs to measure improvement.
recommended_action: Schedule an urgent Business Value Roadmap Session focused on AP automation and finance process improvements
signal_rationale: The customer has explicitly stated plans to cancel their subscription next year due to underutilization (signal REL-06). However, they've recently identified specific use cases around AP automation and finance processes that could deliver immediate value. The signals show they have 4 AP staff processing 100-200 invoices daily manually, creating a clear opportunity for automation. A Business Value Roadmap Session would help quantify the financial impact of these inefficiencies and demonstrate how Domo can address their specific pain points around manual data entry for payroll allocation, invoice processing, and bank data entry into their MIP system.
Play 1 Description: A process in which experienced consultants work directly with clients to identify, articulate and quantify the financial impacts of their analytic decisions. Example: Client needs help identifying where most loss is originating from. What other clients in the same industry are doing to avoid these loss.
Play 2 Name: Cancellation Request
Play 2 Description: Upon discovering the csutomer is saying they may cancel, or if key cancellation risks are surfaced via the risk assessment report, review what elements seem to be most related and contact the customer to discover which options will resonate best whether it's related to commercial factors vs value factors and build an approach to mitigate risk.

account_name: Stephen F Austin Community Health Center, Inc.
name: Tone-Shift Sentiment
summary: The customer has expressed a significant negative shift in sentiment toward Domo, explicitly stating they plan to cancel their subscription next year. After nearly two years with the platform, they feel it has been underutilized and hasn't delivered expected value.
rationale: Linh directly stated: 'we plan to cancel the subscription by next year to be honest with you' and described their account as 'almost like idol now.' She also expressed frustration with the pace of implementation: 'we didn't move too much or too fast enough as we asked for, we expect Domo to be with us.'
action_context: 1. Immediately develop a retention plan with concrete value delivery milestones. 2. Schedule a deep-dive session to understand specific expectations that weren't met. 3. Create a timeline for quick-win implementations to demonstrate immediate value.
recommended_action: Engage Linh (key stakeholder who expressed cancellation intent) in a Client Visit with CS Leadership
signal_rationale: Linh has explicitly stated plans to cancel the subscription next year due to perceived lack of value after two years. She was also unable to attend a recent important meeting about potential use cases. This combination indicates a critical relationship gap that needs immediate attention. A high-level visit would demonstrate Domo's commitment to their success, allow direct discussion of their concerns, and ensure alignment on the newly identified finance use cases. This is especially important given that Linh appears to be a key decision maker regarding the renewal.

account_name: United Parcel Service Oasis Supply Corporation
name: Feature Usage Changed
summary: The team is using App Studio for their dashboard development, which represents a more advanced approach to content creation. This indicates a maturity in their Domo implementation and opens opportunities for more sophisticated solutions.
rationale: Mamta mentions 'app studios is new' when discussing possible reasons for the migration issues, indicating they've recently adopted or are using App Studio for their dashboard development.
action_context: 1. Provide additional App Studio training to help the team overcome migration challenges. 2. Share best practices for App Studio development workflows. 3. Explore additional App Studio features that could enhance their current implementation.

AI Account Signal Context: Schedule Domo Architecture Assessment to address sandbox-to-production migration issues, Schedule AI Agents & Readiness assessment for on-time delivery prediction use case, Implement a Financial Planning Data Product for the international forecasting project
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: Multiple signals indicate recurring issues with sandbox-to-production migrations, particularly with partitioned datasets, variable controls, and app promotions. Raymond is 'constantly reaching out' for access to datasets created in the virtual machine. There are specific errors when promoting cards from UAT to production, with Mamta noting 'we are not fully supporting partition via sandbox' and recommending building in prod directly. These architectural limitations are causing workflow bottlenecks and preventing efficient deployment of critical dashboards, including healthcare reporting., UPS is exploring AI capabilities within Domo, with specific interest in forecasting and predicting on-time deliveries for their international air freight operations. Parsa confirmed this would be valuable: 'It is definitely a good proactive type of thing that would tell us, hey, these shipments are at risk and it could help us to save and improve our time in transit.' Raveendra has already submitted an AI use case for review through UPS's AI governance team. The team is also interested in AI chat capabilities, auto summarization, insights generation, and auto content building. They're considering integration with multiple AI models including Google Gemini, OpenAI via Azure, and Databricks., Multiple signals show UPS is working on a financial forecasting project that requires Domo integration with Google BigQuery. Regina shared her current manual process of creating daily, weekly, and monthly forecasts for leadership using screen scrapes from websites. The team is waiting for BigQuery access credentials to begin implementation. They have a 'wish list' of metrics including volume and revenue by day, region, product, customer, and revenue-specific items like discounts and fuel surcharges. This represents a significant opportunity to replace manual processes with automated reporting and provide leadership with more comprehensive forecasting capabilities.

Call Attendees: Brian Fentress, No Title, Domo; Mamta Bolaki, Sr. Technical Consultant, Domo; Casey Dorman, No Title, Domo; Shelly Valdez, Industrial Engineering Manager, Client; Raymond Alvarez-Torre, Supervisor, Data Management, Client; Gupta Venkatesan, No Title, Unknown
Call Recap: Domo team members discussed various technical issues, including problems with card layouts, data set access, and role permissions. They troubleshot the problems, suggested solutions such as re-promoting changes and involving team members with higher access levels, and agreed to schedule a follow-up meeting to further address the issues. The team also discussed plans for expanding Mamta's consulting practice in India.

account_name: United Parcel Service Oasis Supply Corporation
name: Sandbox Migration Identified
summary: The team is experiencing issues with promoting cards from UAT (sandbox) to production environment. This migration problem is preventing critical healthcare dashboard cards from being properly deployed to end users.
rationale: Raymond explicitly mentions trying to promote content from UAT to production: 'I started to promote' and 'I've pushed it a couple times already this morning.' The conversation revolves around cards that aren't showing up in production despite being in UAT, with specific errors around page layout and variable control.
action_context: 1. Submit a support ticket for the variable control and page layout errors. 2. Investigate why cards in appendix sections aren't migrating properly. 3. Consider alternative deployment methods if promotion continues to fail.
recommended_action: Schedule Domo Architecture Assessment to address sandbox-to-production migration issues
signal_rationale: Multiple signals indicate recurring issues with sandbox-to-production migrations, particularly with partitioned datasets, variable controls, and app promotions. Raymond is 'constantly reaching out' for access to datasets created in the virtual machine. There are specific errors when promoting cards from UAT to production, with Mamta noting 'we are not fully supporting partition via sandbox' and recommending building in prod directly. These architectural limitations are causing workflow bottlenecks and preventing efficient deployment of critical dashboards, including healthcare reporting.

name: Feature Gap / Request
summary: The team is experiencing issues with the variable control functionality during sandbox migration. This appears to be a recurring issue that's preventing proper deployment of dashboard content.
rationale: Brian mentions 'I don't understand it' regarding variable control, and Mamta responds 'Brian's favorite variable control' sarcastically. Brian then asks 'Did we put a ticket in for that?' and Mamta responds 'I don't think so. We need to.' This suggests an ongoing issue with variable control functionality.
action_context: 1. Submit a formal feature enhancement request for the variable control functionality. 2. Document the specific error scenario to help product team understand the issue. 3. Develop workarounds for the current implementation until a fix is available.

name: Feature Gap / Request
summary: Jack has questions about how to structure data dictionaries for AI querying, specifically around handling fields with the same name (like 'status') across different datasets. This represents a potential feature gap in how Domo's AI handles field disambiguation across multiple datasets.
rationale: Jack asked: 'sometimes the context of status, you know, there may be multiple fields called like status, right? And they're contextual to the dataset and I just wanted to understand if there were recommendations or practices around that.' He further questioned if they need to alias fields to make them globally unique when multiple datasets power a dashboard.
action_context: 1. Document clear guidance on field naming conventions for AI readiness. 2. Provide specific recommendations for handling duplicate field names across datasets. 3. Consider scheduling a follow-up with Shane or Ben who have more expertise in this area.
recommended_action: Schedule an AI Agents & Readiness assessment session

name: Business Goal Identified
summary: The client is focused on meeting regulatory compliance and quality standards as evidenced by Inna's role in quality coordination and WAPI program. This indicates a business need for compliance reporting and quality metrics dashboards.
rationale: Inna introduced herself saying, 'I'm just a quality coordinator for the company and doing, you know, like wapi program and stuff like that and looking for guidelines and all the regulations being met?' This clearly indicates a business focus on regulatory compliance and quality standards.
action_context: 1. Research healthcare compliance reporting requirements specific to home health services. 2. Prepare examples of how Domo can help track quality metrics and regulatory compliance. 3. Include compliance reporting capabilities in dashboard planning discussions.

AI Account Signal Context: Implement Architecture Assessment and Optimization for Multiple System Integration, Implement HR & Talent Acquisition Data Product for Employee Analytics, Provide App Studio Training and Enablement for Portal Development
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: The client is struggling with inefficient workflows due to manual data transfers between multiple systems (Monday.com, Carestitch, Kinzer, Snowflake, etc.). Inna explicitly stated 'we just copy information from one program and entering to another, just manually, which actually not very optimal' and 'we're losing our resources.' Multiple signals indicate integration challenges with systems like Lever, Paylocity, and RingCentral. The client has expressed interest in consolidating systems and reducing manual work, with Bellamy stating they're 'trying to move it to Salesforce' and want to 'tie every single one of our back end office functions into one environment.', Multiple signals indicate a strong need for HR and talent acquisition analytics. The client is building department dashboards for HR and TA with specific requirements for tracking employee turnover, reasons for termination, and hiring metrics. Bea (HR) stated 'I want it by region. I want it by title. I want it by reason why they're leaving voluntary versus involuntary.' Kevin (head of TA) needs 'real time data that he needs to understand different hiring needs.' The client has identified Lever and Paylocity as key data sources for these metrics, making them ideal candidates for a comprehensive HR data product., The client is actively exploring App Studio for building clinician portals and customer reports. Bellamy mentioned 'we actually went into the app studio and figured things out ourselves' but also stated 'we do have some questions like it's very elementary, you know, like things like drill downs.' The signals show they've begun self-learning but need additional enablement to maximize this feature. Benjamin identified 'stakeholder portals' as a key use case, 'primarily for the clinicians' with plans to expand to other departments. This represents a significant opportunity to increase platform adoption through proper enablement.

Call Attendees: Inna Levin, Home Health Administrator, Client; Benjamin Parker, Senior Program Manager, Domo; Bellamy Yoo, Director, Client; Ankit Somani, Associate Consultant, Domo; Z S, DA, Client
Call Recap: Shane, Ankit and Benjamin from Domo, along with Bellamy, Z and Inna from 21st Century Home Health Services Inc., discussed the potential use of Domo's workflow and automation capabilities to address the challenges faced by Inna's team, particularly in the Compliance and Concierge departments. The group agreed to prioritize the Compliance department as a starting point for automation, and also explored the possibility of using AI to assist the Concierge team in generating authorization prompts. The meeting concluded with a plan to hold a workflow training session and a roadmapping session to further explore the solutions and determine the next steps.

name: External Integration
summary: The client is interested in integrating data from external systems including Lever (talent acquisition) and Payload City into Domo. These integrations are critical for bringing in data that currently doesn't exist in Domo but is needed for dashboards.
rationale: Ziba mentioned, 'aside from lever, one other I think we were thinking about was payload city' and also stated 'I want your guys's help to figure out if there is an easy way like maybe an API or something we could use to bring in that data because there is data that exists in lever that we don't currently bring in to demo.'
action_context: 1. Research API capabilities for Lever and Payload City integrations. 2. Prepare integration options (connector vs. custom API) for the client. 3. Schedule a technical session to discuss integration requirements in detail.
recommended_action: Implement Architecture Assessment and Optimization for Multiple System Integration
signal_rationale: The client is struggling with inefficient workflows due to manual data transfers between multiple systems (Monday.com, Carestitch, Kinzer, Snowflake, etc.). Inna explicitly stated 'we just copy information from one program and entering to another, just manually, which actually not very optimal' and 'we're losing our resources.' Multiple signals indicate integration challenges with systems like Lever, Paylocity, and RingCentral. The client has expressed interest in consolidating systems and reducing manual work, with Bellamy stating they're 'trying to move it to Salesforce' and want to 'tie every single one of our back end office functions into one environment.'
Play 1 Description: Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: deliver a comprehensive evaluation of your entire Domo implementation, including data modeling, governance structures, user roles, content hierarchy, and security protocols. The assessment benchmarks your environment against Domo best practices and enterprise standards, providing a roadmap for remediation, optimization, and future readiness
Play 2 Name: Domo instance Optimization
Play 2 Description: Non-Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: provides a health check and performance audit of your Domo environment. It includes evaluation of dataflows, dataset duplication, memory usage, dashboard performance, connector health, and governance controls. The result is a set of prioritized recommendations to streamline performance, improve manageability, and extend platform longevity.
Play 3 Description: Non-Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: ocuses on streamlining your data ingestion and transformation processes. It includes auditing ETL logic, identifying inefficiencies in recursive or chained dataflows, removing redundant datasets, and implementing best practices for scheduling and resource usage. The result is faster, more reliable data pipelines that scale with business growth.

AI Account Signal Context: Schedule a technical session focused on App Studio and workflow permissions issues with a product expert, Implement a knowledge transfer plan to build additional Domo expertise beyond Dale Whitchurch, Develop a merger/acquisition support plan to ensure continuity of Domo projects
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: Multiple signals indicate that Dale Whitchurch (identified champion) is experiencing significant technical challenges with App Studio, workflow permissions, and filter context persistence. These issues are causing frustration and potential risk to the relationship. Dale has been described as 'an amazing champion' who 'uses every piece of our platform' but is hitting limitations that require specialized technical support. The tone has shifted negatively with Dale expressing that it's 'getting really frustrating' and they're 'kind of guessing on our own' despite flagging issues 'early in the year.', Signals indicate Dale Whitchurch is the sole technical expert for Domo within IPG Health, creating a potential knowledge gap and single point of failure. Michael noted 'his skill set is so high that there's not really anyone else, in his orbit that has, the capabilities...to understand what Dale's trying to do and help him figure it out.' With the complex implementation involving App Studio, Workflows, and Code Engine across multiple instances, and with upcoming releases affecting nearly 1,000 users, this dependency creates significant risk., Multiple signals indicate IPG Health is undergoing an acquisition by Omnicom (announced in December), creating urgency to complete numerous Domo projects. Lizzie mentioned they're 'in the middle of an acquisition' which has impacted their FP&A system implementation plans. Michael stated there's 'a big push on the ipg side to get a lot of these projects through the door' due to the acquisition. This represents both a risk and opportunity for the Domo relationship during this transition period.

AI Account Signal Context Rationale: Multiple signals indicate recurring issues with sandbox-to-production migrations, particularly with partitioned datasets, variable controls, and app promotions. Raymond is 'constantly reaching out' for access to datasets created in the virtual machine. There are specific errors when promoting cards from UAT to production, with Mamta noting 'we are not fully supporting partition via sandbox' and recommending building in prod directly. These architectural limitations are causing workflow bottlenecks and preventing efficient deployment of critical dashboards, including healthcare reporting., UPS is exploring AI capabilities within Domo, with specific interest in forecasting and predicting on-time deliveries for their international air freight operations. Parsa confirmed this would be valuable: 'It is definitely a good proactive type of thing that would tell us, hey, these shipments are at risk and it could help us to save and improve our time in transit.' Raveendra has already submitted an AI use case for review through UPS's AI governance team. The team is also interested in AI chat capabilities, auto summarization, insights generation, and auto content building. They're considering integration with multiple AI models including Google Gemini, OpenAI via Azure, and Databricks., Multiple signals show UPS is working on a financial forecasting project that requires Domo integration with Google BigQuery. Regina shared her current manual process of creating daily, weekly, and monthly forecasts for leadership using screen scrapes from websites. The team is waiting for BigQuery access credentials to begin implementation. They have a 'wish list' of metrics including volume and revenue by day, region, product, customer, and revenue-specific items like discounts and fuel surcharges. This represents a significant opportunity to replace manual processes with automated reporting and provide leadership with more comprehensive forecasting capabilities.

account_name: United Parcel Service Oasis Supply Corporation
name: Feature Gap / Request
summary: The customer is requesting a change to the time zone configuration in their ETL process, specifically wanting to record timestamps in Eastern Time instead of UTC. This capability gap is causing issues with their partition scheduling and manual refreshes.
rationale: Raymond asked: 'Is there any way to change? The utc to reflect Eastern Time.' He explained the issue: 'if I do a manual refresh... late, say we'll say seven, seven 30 P. M. My time that would be... the next day, utc, right? And so if I do that... things are going to go a little bit sideways.'
action_context: 1. Investigate options for time zone configuration in the ETL process. 2. Provide documentation on how Domo handles time zones in scheduled processes. 3. Consider developing a workaround solution if native time zone adjustment isn't available.

name: Feature Usage Changed
summary: The customer has modified their ETL process by copying logic from an original ETL to a new one and changing the data source. This change has resulted in the loss of historical partitions and requires adjustments to time zone settings.

He also mentioned: 'I copied and pasted all of your tiles to the new ETL' and 'because I changed the data source, all of that history was lost.'

name: Problem Identified
summary: The customer identified a significant problem with their current lab testing system where the relationship between test lines and protocols is broken after creation. This causes inefficiencies as users constantly create new test lines rather than using templates, making it impossible to track changes across multiple protocols.
rationale: Brice stated: 'Our lab is using a software now where if you write a test line and you add it to a protocol like a test, how you want to test this product today, when you add that test line to that protocol, that relationship between the test line and the protocol are broken.' He further explained that this makes the current system 'not useful at all' because users just 'grab the one that was closest to whatever they needed and then go write all their own things in.'
action_context: The account team should focus on demonstrating how Domo can maintain data relationships and serve as a single source of truth. Highlight how Domo's solution would allow updates to propagate across multiple protocols when a test line is changed, addressing the specific pain point mentioned.

name: Feature Gap / Request
summary: The customer expressed a need for a test line database that maintains relationships with protocols, allowing changes to propagate across multiple protocols. This capability is critical for their test management system to enable tracking, trend analysis, and efficient updates.
rationale: Brice stated: 'the test line database is going to be the source of truth and everything points back to it. If you build a protocol, you can't edit the acceptance criteria in the protocol.' He emphasized the importance of maintaining these relationships: 'we want the SPS to be able to make a change to one test line and it changes 50 different protocols.'
action_context: The solution team should evaluate how Domo can address this specific requirement for maintaining relational integrity between test lines and protocols. Consider developing a demo that specifically showcases how changes to a master test line would propagate to all associated protocols.

name: Problem Identified
summary: The client identified that their current Monday.com system is too process-centric and lacks the ability to provide unified patient views or object-oriented record management. This limitation is driving their interest in system changes.
rationale: Bellamy stated, 'right now, everything we lives in Monday.Com for us. But the reason why we want to move into Salesforce is because we get to have a patient view. We get to have object oriented setup of our records right now. This is just too process centric. So there's no easy way to understand what's going on with our patients or what's going on with that particular referral.'
action_context: 1. Explore how Domo can provide a more unified view of patient data even with the current Monday.com system. 2. Discuss how Domo's data model could bridge the gap between process-centric and object-oriented approaches. 3. Demonstrate Domo's ability to create relationship-based views that might address some of their current limitations.

So there's no easy way to understand what's going on with our patients or what's going on with that particular referral.' | AI Recommended Next Steps: 1. AI Account Signal Context: Implement Architecture Assessment and Optimization for Multiple System Integration, Implement HR & Talent Acquisition Data Product for Employee Analytics, Provide App Studio Training and Enablement for Portal Development
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: The client is struggling with inefficient workflows due to manual data transfers between multiple systems (Monday.com, Carestitch, Kinzer, Snowflake, etc.). Inna explicitly stated 'we just copy information from one program and entering to another, just manually, which actually not very optimal' and 'we're losing our resources.' Multiple signals indicate integration challenges with systems like Lever, Paylocity, and RingCentral. The client has expressed interest in consolidating systems and reducing manual work, with Bellamy stating they're 'trying to move it to Salesforce' and want to 'tie every single one of our back end office functions into one environment.', Multiple signals indicate a strong need for HR and talent acquisition analytics. The client is building department dashboards for HR and TA with specific requirements for tracking employee turnover, reasons for termination, and hiring metrics. Bea (HR) stated 'I want it by region. I want it by title. I want it by reason why they're leaving voluntary versus involuntary.' Kevin (head of TA) needs 'real time data that he needs to understand different hiring needs.' The client has identified Lever and Paylocity as key data sources for these metrics, making them ideal candidates for a comprehensive HR data product., The client is actively exploring App Studio for building clinician portals and customer reports. Bellamy mentioned 'we actually went into the app studio and figured things out ourselves' but also stated 'we do have some questions like it's very elementary, you know, like things like drill downs.' The signals show they've begun self-learning but need additional enablement to maximize this feature. Benjamin identified 'stakeholder portals' as a key use case, 'primarily for the clinicians' with plans to expand to other departments. This represents a significant opportunity to increase platform adoption through proper enablement.
Account Action Context: Implement Architecture Assessment and Optimization for Multiple System Integration, Implement HR & Talent Acquisition Data Product for Employee Analytics, Provide App Studio Training and Enablement for Portal Development

Call Attendees: Ankit Somani, Associate Consultant, Domo; Benjamin Parker, Senior Program Manager, Domo; Shane Wright, Technical Consultant, Domo; Bellamy Yoo, Director, Client; Z S, DA, Client
Call Recap: Domo team members discussed the development of various dashboards for the client's departments, including clinical operations, talent acquisition/HR, finance, office, and executive. They also explored the possibility of an AI-powered tool for clinicians and a clinician portal, and agreed to prioritize the dashboard development, with clinical operations and talent acquisition/HR being the top priorities. The team plans to gather the necessary data requirements and discuss the dashboards and visualizations in more detail during the next meeting on Friday.

name: External Integration
summary: The client is considering moving from Monday.com to Salesforce and wants to ensure Domo can integrate with their future ecosystem. This integration requirement is critical for their data strategy and operational workflows.
rationale: Bellamy mentioned, 'We're going to, yeah, have [Salesforce]' and 'if there's a way Domo can help us out without us having to move into Salesforce, great too.' They also explained their motivation: 'the reason why we want to move into Salesforce is because we get to have a patient view' and 'our intention is to tie every single one of our back end office functions into one environment.'
action_context: 1. Prepare a demonstration of Domo's Salesforce connector capabilities. 2. Discuss how Domo can complement their Salesforce implementation rather than compete with it. 3. Develop a phased integration approach that aligns with their Salesforce migration timeline.
recommended_action: Implement Architecture Assessment and Optimization for Multiple System Integration
signal_rationale: The client is struggling with inefficient workflows due to manual data transfers between multiple systems (Monday.com, Carestitch, Kinzer, Snowflake, etc.). Inna explicitly stated 'we just copy information from one program and entering to another, just manually, which actually not very optimal' and 'we're losing our resources.' Multiple signals indicate integration challenges with systems like Lever, Paylocity, and RingCentral. The client has expressed interest in consolidating systems and reducing manual work, with Bellamy stating they're 'trying to move it to Salesforce' and want to 'tie every single one of our back end office functions into one environment.'
Play 1 Description: Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: deliver a comprehensive evaluation of your entire Domo implementation, including data modeling, governance structures, user roles, content hierarchy, and security protocols. The assessment benchmarks your environment against Domo best practices and enterprise standards, providing a roadmap for remediation, optimization, and future readiness
Play 2 Name: Domo instance Optimization
Play 2 Description: Non-Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: provides a health check and performance audit of your Domo environment. It includes evaluation of dataflows, dataset duplication, memory usage, dashboard performance, connector health, and governance controls. The result is a set of prioritized recommendations to streamline performance, improve manageability, and extend platform longevity.
Play 3 Description: Non-Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: ocuses on streamlining your data ingestion and transformation processes. It includes auditing ETL logic, identifying inefficiencies in recursive or chained dataflows, removing redundant datasets, and implementing best practices for scheduling and resource usage. The result is faster, more reliable data pipelines that scale with business growth.

play_1_description: Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: deliver a comprehensive evaluation of your entire Domo implementation, including data modeling, governance structures, user roles, content hierarchy, and security protocols. play_1_initiating_role: Customer Success Manager, Account Executive, Professional Services, Partner
play_2_description: Non-Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: provides a health check and performance audit of your Domo environment. It includes evaluation of dataflows, dataset duplication, memory usage, dashboard performance, connector health, and governance controls. The result is a set of prioritized recommendations to streamline performance, improve manageability, and extend platform longevity.
play_3_description: Non-Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: ocuses on streamlining your data ingestion and transformation processes. It includes auditing ETL logic, identifying inefficiencies in recursive or chained dataflows, removing redundant datasets, and implementing best practices for scheduling and resource usage. The result is faster, more reliable data pipelines that scale with business growth.

name: Umbrella Use Case Identified
summary: Workflow Automation & Operational Efficiency: The client discussed moving their claims tracking and operational processes from Monday.com to a more integrated system. This represents an opportunity to help streamline their operational workflows through Domo.
rationale: Bellamy showed their current process tracking claims denials and mentioned 'We have a working board where we track on every single claims that comes in our way that gets denied.' They also discussed how they're 'trying to move it to Salesforce too, not Monday.com' because they're 'overly utilizing this quite a bit,' indicating a need for workflow automation and operational efficiency improvements.
action_context: 1. Explore how Domo's workflow capabilities could replace some of their Monday.com processes. 2. Discuss integration options between Domo and their planned Salesforce implementation. 3. Demonstrate how Domo can provide the operational visibility they're seeking.

name: Problem Identified
summary: The client identified that their current Monday.com system is too process-centric and lacks the ability to provide unified patient views or object-oriented record management. This limitation is driving their interest in system changes.
rationale: Bellamy stated, 'right now, everything we lives in Monday.Com for us. But the reason why we want to move into Salesforce is because we get to have a patient view. We get to have object oriented setup of our records right now. This is just too process centric. So there's no easy way to understand what's going on with our patients or what's going on with that particular referral.'
action_context: 1. Explore how Domo can provide a more unified view of patient data even with the current Monday.com system. 2. Discuss how Domo's data model could bridge the gap between process-centric and object-oriented approaches. 3. Demonstrate Domo's ability to create relationship-based views that might address some of their current limitations.

name: Champion Affirmed
summary: Andrew identified Brittany as a strong internal champion who drives execution and accountability. Having a recognized champion at the director level significantly improves adoption prospects and project success rates.

This clearly positions her as an internal champion for Domo initiatives.

Andrew stated he 'sleeps better at night' because of Brittany's leadership. Strengthening Brittany's champion role through targeted enablement will accelerate adoption and maximize platform value across Bass Pro.
Play 1 Name: Domo Best Practices Demo/Deep Dive Enablement (ACE)

As part of getting a customer fully onboard for large implementations, or as a program to shore up low adotpion or consumption growth, onsite training events can enable many users in a customer-centered approach.

Call Title: IPGH and Domo introduction to Adoption team

name: Relationship Gap / Exposure
summary: Dale appears to be the sole technical expert for Domo within IPG Health, creating a potential knowledge gap and single point of failure. His unique skill level means there's limited internal support for his advanced implementations.
rationale: Michael notes 'his skill set is so high that there's not really anyone else, in his orbit that has, the capabilities...to understand what Dale's trying to do and help him figure it out.' This indicates a lack of other skilled Domo users who could support or back up Dale's work.
action_context: Develop a knowledge transfer plan to build additional Domo expertise within IPG Health. Identify potential power users who could be trained to support Dale's initiatives. Consider creating documentation of Dale's custom solutions to preserve institutional knowledge.

play_1_description: Cohort of people from multiple customers. Can be immersion or Hands on. Customers can send one or more people, but it's shared by others from other companies.
play_2_description: This is a felxible presentation to a leader or decision maker  we want to allign with that supports the value proposition of Domo in their organization. This can be used during initial discovery and selction as well as anytime post-sale that we need to enlist the vision of an existing or new leader to enlist them as an ally to support an expanding roadmap of features, people, and use cases. Can be stand-alone or part of a Domo Day that also includes other services.
play_3_description:
Before onboard is complete of an implementing use case, or upon disovery that the value partnership isn't in place for existing use case(s), reach out to the key stake holder or business leader to arrange the level and cadence they will accept from us to map value and or provide recurring value check ins or quarterly business reviews. 
CSM-led check-in with tactical customer team (periodic, per Joint impact plan agreement?)
•Use Case progress check list
•Health Grade Review
•CSAT results

AI Account Signal Context: Implement Finance Advanced Data Product to enhance financial planning and pricing optimization, Conduct Domo Pipeline Optimization to improve their data integration and ETL processes, Implement Advanced Marketing Data Product to enhance their marketing analytics capabilities
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: The signals show Cozy Earth is heavily focused on financial planning, pricing optimization, and profit maximization. They're running pricing scenarios to analyze impacts on revenue, inventory, and profitability (signal 924be799). They're using Domo to determine optimal pricing strategies that balance revenue growth with maintaining acceptable profit margins (signal 0b6e8caf). Their business goal is explicitly to maximize profit dollars through optimized pricing (signal 04d31db9). The Finance Advanced Data Product would provide comprehensive financial analytics across revenue, profitability, expenses, and cash flow, with scenario modeling capabilities that directly address their current use cases., Trevor mentioned they're using Domo as their data warehouse with all their data feeding into Domo and all pipelines built within Domo (signal 099f942a). They're also integrating data from another platform that handles price testing with Domo for profitability analysis (signal 51795cf7). Given their heavy reliance on Domo for data warehousing and ETL, optimizing their data pipelines would improve performance, reliability, and scalability. The Pipeline Optimization would audit ETL logic, identify inefficiencies, remove redundant datasets, and implement best practices for scheduling and resource usage., Trevor explicitly stated they are 'very marketing heavy' with much of their Domo implementation focused on 'different visuals and data to ultimately support the marketing team' (signal 7906c8bb). The marketing team was identified as primary users of Domo (signal 59ee9eef). The Advanced Marketing Data Product would streamline their campaign planning, optimization, and attribution, helping them maximize media impact and ROI. This aligns perfectly with their heavy marketing focus and would enhance their existing marketing analytics use case.

The Domo team offered to provide training, consulting, and ongoing support to Cozy Earth as part of the Adoption Engine program.

AI Account Signal Context: Schedule Domo Architecture Assessment to address sandbox-to-production migration issues, Schedule AI Agents & Readiness assessment for on-time delivery prediction use case, Implement a Financial Planning Data Product for the international forecasting project
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: Multiple signals indicate recurring issues with sandbox-to-production migrations, particularly with partitioned datasets, variable controls, and app promotions. Raymond is 'constantly reaching out' for access to datasets created in the virtual machine. There are specific errors when promoting cards from UAT to production, with Mamta noting 'we are not fully supporting partition via sandbox' and recommending building in prod directly. These architectural limitations are causing workflow bottlenecks and preventing efficient deployment of critical dashboards, including healthcare reporting., UPS is exploring AI capabilities within Domo, with specific interest in forecasting and predicting on-time deliveries for their international air freight operations. Parsa confirmed this would be valuable: 'It is definitely a good proactive type of thing that would tell us, hey, these shipments are at risk and it could help us to save and improve our time in transit.' Raveendra has already submitted an AI use case for review through UPS's AI governance team. The team is also interested in AI chat capabilities, auto summarization, insights generation, and auto content building. They're considering integration with multiple AI models including Google Gemini, OpenAI via Azure, and Databricks., Multiple signals show UPS is working on a financial forecasting project that requires Domo integration with Google BigQuery. Regina shared her current manual process of creating daily, weekly, and monthly forecasts for leadership using screen scrapes from websites. The team is waiting for BigQuery access credentials to begin implementation. They have a 'wish list' of metrics including volume and revenue by day, region, product, customer, and revenue-specific items like discounts and fuel surcharges. This represents a significant opportunity to replace manual processes with automated reporting and provide leadership with more comprehensive forecasting capabilities.

Call Attendees: Casey Dorman, No Title, Domo; Vadim Ratokhin, Director, Information Technology, Client; Kevin Wilck, Manager Strategic Accounts, Domo; William Dubois, No Title, Domo; Kathy Hlebica, Director, Ocean Freight and Supplier Management Services, Client; Steve McMichael, VP, UPS Ocean, Client; Parsa Naraghi, Director, Global ASC Coordinator, Global Freight Forwarding, Client; Devin Paulk, Product Manager, Symphony, Client; Keith Andrey, President, US Freight Forwarding, Client; Braxton Fullenkamp, No Title, Domo; Amit Podder, Director of Software Engineering, Client
Call Recap: Domo team members, along with Vadim, Steve, Devin, Amit, Parsa, Kathy, William Stone, Dallas and Keith, discussed the progress of various initiatives, including supplier management, Symphony adoption, and the use of Domo's AI capabilities. The group also addressed the need for a comprehensive governance strategy to ensure the effective and standardized use of Domo across the organization, with a focus on establishing a Domo charter, data dictionary, and approval process. The meeting highlighted the importance of aligning Domo usage with the company's overall data strategy and the need to track specific metrics to measure the value Domo is bringing to the business.

account_name: United Parcel Service Oasis Supply Corporation
name: Architecture Gap Identified
summary: UPS is experiencing issues with 12-13 different local workbenches that are described as 'fragile,' causing data update problems and negative platform perception. This architectural weakness is driving interest in moving to the enterprise workbench solution.
rationale: Chris stated 'we have a perception issue because there's you know, 12 or 13 different local workbenches running, and of course, running them locally means they're a little bit fragile, which means that sometimes data is not updated, which means ultimately people think Domo looks bad when it's not Domo's fault.'
action_context: 1. Accelerate the enterprise workbench migration planning with clear benefits documentation. 2. Provide interim solutions to stabilize the local workbenches during transition. 3. Create a communication plan to address perception issues while the architectural improvements are implemented.

AI Account Signal Context: Implement Architecture Assessment and Optimization for Multiple System Integration, Implement HR & Talent Acquisition Data Product for Employee Analytics, Provide App Studio Training and Enablement for Portal Development
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: The client is struggling with inefficient workflows due to manual data transfers between multiple systems (Monday.com, Carestitch, Kinzer, Snowflake, etc.). Inna explicitly stated 'we just copy information from one program and entering to another, just manually, which actually not very optimal' and 'we're losing our resources.' Multiple signals indicate integration challenges with systems like Lever, Paylocity, and RingCentral. The client has expressed interest in consolidating systems and reducing manual work, with Bellamy stating they're 'trying to move it to Salesforce' and want to 'tie every single one of our back end office functions into one environment.', Multiple signals indicate a strong need for HR and talent acquisition analytics. The client is building department dashboards for HR and TA with specific requirements for tracking employee turnover, reasons for termination, and hiring metrics. Bea (HR) stated 'I want it by region. I want it by title. I want it by reason why they're leaving voluntary versus involuntary.' Kevin (head of TA) needs 'real time data that he needs to understand different hiring needs.' The client has identified Lever and Paylocity as key data sources for these metrics, making them ideal candidates for a comprehensive HR data product., The client is actively exploring App Studio for building clinician portals and customer reports. Bellamy mentioned 'we actually went into the app studio and figured things out ourselves' but also stated 'we do have some questions like it's very elementary, you know, like things like drill downs.' The signals show they've begun self-learning but need additional enablement to maximize this feature. Benjamin identified 'stakeholder portals' as a key use case, 'primarily for the clinicians' with plans to expand to other departments. This represents a significant opportunity to increase platform adoption through proper enablement.

name: Source-System Identified
summary: The customer has address data already loaded into Domo that needs to be enhanced with latitude/longitude coordinates. This indicates they have an existing data source integrated with Domo that contains location information for their business operations.
rationale: The customer stated: 'The data's already loaded into Domo' when discussing the address data they need to enhance with latitude/longitude coordinates. They also mentioned: 'we have a lot of address data, but we don't have lat long' indicating they have a specific source system feeding address data into Domo.
action_context: 1. Identify the specific dataset in Domo containing the address information. 2. Implement a geocoding solution to enrich this data with lat/long coordinates. 3. Ensure the data pipeline maintains consistency between the source system and the enhanced dataset.

name: External Integration
summary: The customer needs to integrate with Google Maps API for geocoding their address data into latitude/longitude coordinates. This external integration is critical for enabling their desired map visualization functionality.
rationale: The conversation included discussion about obtaining a Google API key: 'do you have an API key for Google that we could use to authenticate?' and exploring the Google Cloud Console to set up the integration. They specifically mentioned needing the Geocoding API to convert addresses to coordinates.
action_context: 1. Assist the customer in setting up their Google Cloud project and obtaining the necessary API key. 2. Implement the geocoding integration using Domo's Python or Jupiter notebook capabilities. 3. Ensure the integration is scalable to handle 'tens of thousands' of addresses as mentioned by the customer.

name: External Integration
summary: Home Depot is considering integration between Domo and TradeBeyond's PLM system. This integration opportunity is complicated by TradeBeyond's incomplete development status for the test management module Home Depot needs.
rationale: Phil asked about whether 'it make sense for us to start talking with them now' regarding TradeBeyond integration. Brice responded that TradeBeyond is 'overwhelmed' and 'don't even have the tables to even show you' for their section, indicating integration challenges but confirming it's being considered.
action_context: 1. Develop a phased integration approach that can adapt as TradeBeyond's system matures. 2. Create documentation of Domo's API capabilities relevant to test management systems. 3. Prepare for potential technical discussions with TradeBeyond in December/January timeframe.

These concrete ROI examples should be documented and leveraged to drive expansion across other Home Depot departments.

name: Problem Identified
summary: Home Depot's lab is experiencing significant issues with their current test management system where relationships between test lines and protocols are broken after creation. This leads to inconsistent testing processes and inefficient updates requiring manual changes across multiple protocols.
rationale: Brice explicitly stated their current system is 'not useful at all' because when test lines are added to protocols 'that relationship between the test line and the protocol are broken.' He explained how this forces users to 'basically making a new test line every time' and requires updating '50 different protocols' individually when changes are needed.
action_context: 1. Document the specific pain points around broken relationships between test lines and protocols. 2. Demonstrate how Domo can maintain referential integrity between test components. 3. Create a comparison showing efficiency gains from maintaining source-of-truth relationships.

AI Account Signal Context Rationale: Multiple signals indicate that Dale Whitchurch (identified champion) is experiencing significant technical challenges with App Studio, workflow permissions, and filter context persistence. The tone has shifted negatively with Dale expressing that it's 'getting really frustrating' and they're 'kind of guessing on our own' despite flagging issues 'early in the year.', Signals indicate Dale Whitchurch is the sole technical expert for Domo within IPG Health, creating a potential knowledge gap and single point of failure. With the complex implementation involving App Studio, Workflows, and Code Engine across multiple instances, and with upcoming releases affecting nearly 1,000 users, this dependency creates significant risk., Multiple signals indicate IPG Health is undergoing an acquisition by Omnicom (announced in December), creating urgency to complete numerous Domo projects. Lizzie mentioned they're 'in the middle of an acquisition' which has impacted their FP&A system implementation plans. Michael stated there's 'a big push on the ipg side to get a lot of these projects through the door' due to the acquisition. This represents both a risk and opportunity for the Domo relationship during this transition period.

These concrete ROI examples should be documented and leveraged to drive expansion across other Home Depot departments.
Call Attendees: Phil Stewart, No Title, Domo; Todd Budzinski, Merchandisng Director, Client; Matthew Newsom, Solutions Consultant, Domo
Call Recap: Matthew and Phil from Domo, along with Todd from Home Depot U.S.A., Inc., discussed Domo's capabilities, including its data integration, transformation, and visualization features, as well as the pricing model and implementation process at Home Depot. They agreed to schedule a collaborative session to set up a trial account and explore how Domo can address Home Depot's specific needs, such as managing the "paint desk initiative" and automating certain buying decisions through workflows and AI-powered insights.

AI Account Signal Context Rationale: The client is struggling with inefficient workflows due to manual data transfers between multiple systems (Monday.com, Carestitch, Kinzer, Snowflake, etc.). AI Account Signal Context: Schedule a technical session focused on App Studio and workflow permissions issues with a product expert, Implement a knowledge transfer plan to build additional Domo expertise beyond Dale Whitchurch, Develop a merger/acquisition support plan to ensure continuity of Domo projects
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: Multiple signals indicate that Dale Whitchurch (identified champion) is experiencing significant technical challenges with App Studio, workflow permissions, and filter context persistence. These issues are causing frustration and potential risk to the relationship. Dale has been described as 'an amazing champion' who 'uses every piece of our platform' but is hitting limitations that require specialized technical support. The tone has shifted negatively with Dale expressing that it's 'getting really frustrating' and they're 'kind of guessing on our own' despite flagging issues 'early in the year.', Signals indicate Dale Whitchurch is the sole technical expert for Domo within IPG Health, creating a potential knowledge gap and single point of failure. Michael noted 'his skill set is so high that there's not really anyone else, in his orbit that has, the capabilities...to understand what Dale's trying to do and help him figure it out.' With the complex implementation involving App Studio, Workflows, and Code Engine across multiple instances, and with upcoming releases affecting nearly 1,000 users, this dependency creates significant risk., Multiple signals indicate IPG Health is undergoing an acquisition by Omnicom (announced in December), creating urgency to complete numerous Domo projects. Lizzie mentioned they're 'in the middle of an acquisition' which has impacted their FP&A system implementation plans. Michael stated there's 'a big push on the ipg side to get a lot of these projects through the door' due to the acquisition. This represents both a risk and opportunity for the Domo relationship during this transition period.

Call Title: Domo | Stephen F. Austin Community Health Center
Call Attendees: Ankit Somani, Associate Consultant, Domo; David Sykes, Accountant Assistant, Client; Benjamin Parker, Senior Program Manager, Domo; Michelle Calzadilla, No Title, Client; Shane Wright, Technical Consultant, Domo; Sabrina Purtell, No Title, Client
Call Recap: Shane, Benjamin and Ankit from Domo, along with Sabrina, David and Michelle from Stephen F Austin Community Health Center, Inc., discussed the possibility of automating the accounts payable process by integrating Domo with the MIP accounting system used by Stephen F Austin. The key highlights were the volume of invoices processed daily, the file formats of the invoices, the potential to leverage the MIP API to automate data extraction and entry, and the need to test the integration in a development environment before implementing it in production. The team agreed to share sample invoices and further explore the technical details of the MIP API to determine the best approach for the integration.

account_name: Stephen F Austin Community Health Center, Inc.
name: Umbrella Use Case Identified
summary: Workflow Automation & Operational Efficiency: The team has identified AP automation as a key use case, focusing on automating the manual entry of invoice data into their AP system. This will significantly reduce the time-consuming process currently handled by four staff members processing 100-200 invoices each per day.
rationale: Benjamin P stated, 'We've identified this AP automation as one use case' and described the goal as 'to adjust those files and to the best of our ability, pull out as much of that information that you're manually entering as possible and pre populate that on a form.' Michelle C confirmed the volume stating they have 'four AP staff members' who 'enter roughly anywhere from 100 to 200 invoices a day.'
action_context: Focus implementation on automating invoice data extraction from PDFs which represent 90-95% of all invoices. Prioritize pharmaceutical vendors (Cardinal Health, McKesson, RX) as they represent the highest volume with consistent GL codes. Ensure the solution can handle the 5-10% of invoices that come in Excel format.

Call Attendees: Ankit Somani, Associate Consultant, Domo; David Sykes, Accountant Assistant, Client; Benjamin Parker, Senior Program Manager, Domo; Michelle Calzadilla, No Title, Client; Shane Wright, Technical Consultant, Domo; Sabrina Purtell, No Title, Client
Call Recap: Shane, Benjamin and Ankit from Domo, along with Sabrina, David and Michelle from Stephen F Austin Community Health Center, Inc., discussed the possibility of automating the accounts payable process by integrating Domo with the MIP accounting system used by Stephen F Austin. The key highlights were the volume of invoices processed daily, the file formats of the invoices, the potential to leverage the MIP API to automate data extraction and entry, and the need to test the integration in a development environment before implementing it in production. The team agreed to share sample invoices and further explore the technical details of the MIP API to determine the best approach for the integration.

account_name: Stephen F Austin Community Health Center, Inc.
name: Umbrella Use Case Identified
summary: Workflow Automation & Operational Efficiency: The team has identified AP automation as a key use case, focusing on automating the manual entry of invoice data into their AP system. This will significantly reduce the time-consuming process currently handled by four staff members processing 100-200 invoices each per day.
rationale: Benjamin P stated, 'We've identified this AP automation as one use case' and described the goal as 'to adjust those files and to the best of our ability, pull out as much of that information that you're manually entering as possible and pre populate that on a form.' Michelle C confirmed the volume stating they have 'four AP staff members' who 'enter roughly anywhere from 100 to 200 invoices a day.'
action_context: Focus implementation on automating invoice data extraction from PDFs which represent 90-95% of all invoices. Prioritize pharmaceutical vendors (Cardinal Health, McKesson, RX) as they represent the highest volume with consistent GL codes. Ensure the solution can handle the 5-10% of invoices that come in Excel format.
recommended_action: Implement a Use Case Sprint for AP automation with a focus on pharmaceutical vendor invoices
signal_rationale: The customer has identified a clear, high-value use case around AP automation where four staff members are manually processing 100-200 invoices daily. They've specifically highlighted pharmaceutical vendors (Cardinal Health, McKesson, RX) as having the most repetitive invoices, with 90-95% coming as PDFs. This represents an ideal candidate for a rapid implementation that could show immediate value to a customer who is planning to cancel. A Use Case Sprint would quickly validate the solution and demonstrate Domo's value in addressing their specific pain point.

account_name: Stephen F Austin Community Health Center, Inc.
name: Problem Identified
summary: The client has a manual, time-consuming process for invoice data entry into their AP system. Four staff members are each processing 100-200 invoices daily, representing a significant operational burden that could be automated to improve efficiency.
rationale: Benjamin P identified the problem: 'you guys have invoices and the process of entering data from those invoices into your AP system is pretty time consuming.' Michelle C confirmed the scale: 'we have four AP staff members assigned to accounts payable and entering invoices. They enter roughly anywhere from 100 to 200 invoices a day.'
action_context: Quantify the current time spent on manual entry to establish a baseline for measuring improvement. Identify the most repetitive invoice types (pharmaceutical expenses) as initial targets for automation. Develop a solution that can handle both PDF (90-95%) and Excel (5-10%) invoice formats.
recommended_action: Implement a Use Case Sprint for AP automation with a focus on pharmaceutical vendor invoices
signal_rationale: The customer has identified a clear, high-value use case around AP automation where four staff members are manually processing 100-200 invoices daily. They've specifically highlighted pharmaceutical vendors (Cardinal Health, McKesson, RX) as having the most repetitive invoices, with 90-95% coming as PDFs. This represents an ideal candidate for a rapid implementation that could show immediate value to a customer who is planning to cancel. A Use Case Sprint would quickly validate the solution and demonstrate Domo's value in addressing their specific pain point.

account_name: Stephen F Austin Community Health Center, Inc.
name: Source-System Identified
summary: The client receives invoices primarily as PDF files (90-95%) with some Excel files (5-10%) from vendors. These invoices, particularly from pharmaceutical vendors like Cardinal Health and McKesson, will serve as the source data for the AP automation solution.
rationale: Michelle C confirmed the file formats: 'most are PDF files, but you have some vendors that send excel files' and quantified the split: 'Maybe five to 10 percent' are non-PDF. She also identified key vendors: 'pharmaceutical expenses are the ones that are the most repetitive... vendors like cardinal health, mckesson, RX.'
action_context: Collect sample invoices from the top vendors, especially Cardinal Health and McKesson, to analyze their structure. Develop extraction templates for the most common invoice formats. Ensure the solution can handle both PDF and Excel formats with consistent output.
recommended_action: Implement a Use Case Sprint for AP automation with a focus on pharmaceutical vendor invoices
signal_rationale: The customer has identified a clear, high-value use case around AP automation where four staff members are manually processing 100-200 invoices daily. They've specifically highlighted pharmaceutical vendors (Cardinal Health, McKesson, RX) as having the most repetitive invoices, with 90-95% coming as PDFs. This represents an ideal candidate for a rapid implementation that could show immediate value to a customer who is planning to cancel. A Use Case Sprint would quickly validate the solution and demonstrate Domo's value in addressing their specific pain point.

name: Relationship Gap / Exposure
summary: A key stakeholder, Linh, was unable to attend the meeting which could impact decision-making and project momentum. Having this stakeholder missing from critical planning discussions represents a relationship gap that needs to be addressed.
rationale: David S mentioned: 'I know we were hoping that Linh would be able to join us for this meeting, but unfortunately, she does have a conflict and will not be able to join.' Later, he requested the recording 'just in case, Linh, wants to review it after she gets back,' indicating her importance to the project.
action_context: Ensure Linh receives the meeting recording and a detailed summary of decisions made. Schedule a follow-up touchpoint specifically with Linh to address any questions or concerns she might have. Consider her availability when scheduling future critical meetings.
recommended_action: Engage Linh (key stakeholder who expressed cancellation intent) in a Client Visit with CS Leadership
signal_rationale: Linh has explicitly stated plans to cancel the subscription next year due to perceived lack of value after two years. She was also unable to attend a recent important meeting about potential use cases. This combination indicates a critical relationship gap that needs immediate attention. A high-level visit would demonstrate Domo's commitment to their success, allow direct discussion of their concerns, and ensure alignment on the newly identified finance use cases. This is especially important given that Linh appears to be a key decision maker regarding the renewal.

Call Recap: Shane, Benjamin and Ankit from Domo, along with Sabrina, David and Michelle from Stephen F Austin Community Health Center, Inc., discussed the possibility of automating the accounts payable process by integrating Domo with the MIP accounting system used by Stephen F Austin. The key highlights were the volume of invoices processed daily, the file formats of the invoices, the potential to leverage the MIP API to automate data extraction and entry, and the need to test the integration in a development environment before implementing it in production. The team agreed to share sample invoices and further explore the technical details of the MIP API to determine the best approach for the integration.

name: Architecture Gap Identified
summary: A significant architecture gap exists where data must be manually transferred between multiple systems (Monday.com, Carestitch, and Kinzer). This manual process is inefficient and wastes resources as noted by the client.
rationale: Inna explicitly stated, 'we just copy information from one program and entering to another, just manually, which actually not very optimal' and 'we're losing our resources.' Marlee also asked about finding 'a single way to enter' data instead of duplicating efforts across systems.
action_context: 1. Conduct a detailed workflow analysis to identify all manual data transfer points. 2. Develop a proposal for streamlining data flows between systems. 3. Discuss potential automation options within Domo's capabilities.
recommended_action: Implement Architecture Assessment and Optimization for Multiple System Integration
signal_rationale: The client is struggling with inefficient workflows due to manual data transfers between multiple systems (Monday.com, Carestitch, Kinzer, Snowflake, etc.). Inna explicitly stated 'we just copy information from one program and entering to another, just manually, which actually not very optimal' and 'we're losing our resources.' Multiple signals indicate integration challenges with systems like Lever, Paylocity, and RingCentral. The client has expressed interest in consolidating systems and reducing manual work, with Bellamy stating they're 'trying to move it to Salesforce' and want to 'tie every single one of our back end office functions into one environment.'
Play 1 Description: Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: deliver a comprehensive evaluation of your entire Domo implementation, including data modeling, governance structures, user roles, content hierarchy, and security protocols. The assessment benchmarks your environment against Domo best practices and enterprise standards, providing a roadmap for remediation, optimization, and future readiness
Play 2 Name: Domo instance Optimization
Play 2 Description: Non-Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: provides a health check and performance audit of your Domo environment. It includes evaluation of dataflows, dataset duplication, memory usage, dashboard performance, connector health, and governance controls. The result is a set of prioritized recommendations to streamline performance, improve manageability, and extend platform longevity.
Play 3 Description: Non-Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: ocuses on streamlining your data ingestion and transformation processes. It includes auditing ETL logic, identifying inefficiencies in recursive or chained dataflows, removing redundant datasets, and implementing best practices for scheduling and resource usage. The result is faster, more reliable data pipelines that scale with business growth.

AI Account Signal Context: Implement Architecture Assessment and Optimization for Multiple System Integration, Implement HR & Talent Acquisition Data Product for Employee Analytics, Provide App Studio Training and Enablement for Portal Development
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: The client is struggling with inefficient workflows due to manual data transfers between multiple systems (Monday.com, Carestitch, Kinzer, Snowflake, etc.). Inna explicitly stated 'we just copy information from one program and entering to another, just manually, which actually not very optimal' and 'we're losing our resources.' Multiple signals indicate integration challenges with systems like Lever, Paylocity, and RingCentral. The client has expressed interest in consolidating systems and reducing manual work, with Bellamy stating they're 'trying to move it to Salesforce' and want to 'tie every single one of our back end office functions into one environment.', Multiple signals indicate a strong need for HR and talent acquisition analytics. The client is building department dashboards for HR and TA with specific requirements for tracking employee turnover, reasons for termination, and hiring metrics. Bea (HR) stated 'I want it by region. I want it by title. I want it by reason why they're leaving voluntary versus involuntary.' Kevin (head of TA) needs 'real time data that he needs to understand different hiring needs.' The client has identified Lever and Paylocity as key data sources for these metrics, making them ideal candidates for a comprehensive HR data product., The client is actively exploring App Studio for building clinician portals and customer reports. Bellamy mentioned 'we actually went into the app studio and figured things out ourselves' but also stated 'we do have some questions like it's very elementary, you know, like things like drill downs.' The signals show they've begun self-learning but need additional enablement to maximize this feature. Benjamin identified 'stakeholder portals' as a key use case, 'primarily for the clinicians' with plans to expand to other departments. This represents a significant opportunity to increase platform adoption through proper enablement.

Call Title: Domo <> Compliance: Departmental Dashboard/Analytics Requirement Gathering
Call Attendees: Inna Levin, Home Health Administrator, Client; Marlee Moleta, No Title, Client; Bellamy Yoo, Director, Client; Benjamin Parker, Senior Program Manager, Domo
Call Recap: Domo team members discussed the compliance department's use of various systems, including Monday.com, Carestitch, and Kinser, to manage patient admissions and data. They explored opportunities to optimize the data flow and reporting processes, focusing on automating manual tasks, analyzing productivity metrics, and addressing technical challenges with data integration and visualization in Domo.

name: External Integration
summary: The client expressed interest in integrating Domo with their existing systems (Monday.com, Carestitch, and Kinzer) to reduce manual data entry. However, technical limitations were identified as Carestitch and Kinzer lack API capabilities.
rationale: Marlee asked about integration possibilities: 'If there's any way that we can find a single way to enter only...' Bellamy responded that while 'Domo can help with that,' there are limitations since 'carestitch is not API' and there's 'no pulling and no pushing either for carestitch and Kinzer.'
action_context: 1. Clarify Domo's integration capabilities with non-API systems. 2. Explore alternative integration approaches like scheduled data exports/imports. 3. Coordinate with the client's 'snowflake and mulesoft team' for potential integration solutions.
recommended_action: Implement Architecture Assessment and Optimization for Multiple System Integration

rationale: Marlee mentioned that they work with data across 'carestitch, Kinser, and Monday.com' and Inna confirmed they're 'transitioning data from Monday.com, from carestitch to Monday.com basically, and from Kinzer, to Monday.com.' These are clearly identified as source systems containing patient and compliance data.
action_context: 1. Document these source systems in the account architecture map. 2. Explore potential integration options between these systems and Domo. 3. Discuss with the technical team about data extraction possibilities from these systems.

These systems contain critical patient data that the compliance team needs to manually transfer between platforms, creating inefficiencies. | signal rationale: Marlee mentioned that they work with data across 'carestitch, Kinser, and Monday.com' and Inna confirmed they're 'transitioning data from Monday.com, from carestitch to Monday.com basically, and from Kinzer, to Monday.com.'
