AI Account Signal Context: Implement Architecture Assessment and Optimization for Multiple System Integration, Implement HR & Talent Acquisition Data Product for Employee Analytics, Provide App Studio Training and Enablement for Portal Development
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: The client is struggling with inefficient workflows due to manual data transfers between multiple systems (Monday.com, Carestitch, Kinzer, Snowflake, etc.). Inna explicitly stated 'we just copy information from one program and entering to another, just manually, which actually not very optimal' and 'we're losing our resources.' Multiple signals indicate integration challenges with systems like Lever, Paylocity, and RingCentral. The client has expressed interest in consolidating systems and reducing manual work, with Bellamy stating they're 'trying to move it to Salesforce' and want to 'tie every single one of our back end office functions into one environment.', Multiple signals indicate a strong need for HR and talent acquisition analytics. The client is building department dashboards for HR and TA with specific requirements for tracking employee turnover, reasons for termination, and hiring metrics. Bea (HR) stated 'I want it by region. I want it by title. I want it by reason why they're leaving voluntary versus involuntary.' Kevin (head of TA) needs 'real time data that he needs to understand different hiring needs.' The client has identified Lever and Paylocity as key data sources for these metrics, making them ideal candidates for a comprehensive HR data product., The client is actively exploring App Studio for building clinician portals and customer reports. Bellamy mentioned 'we actually went into the app studio and figured things out ourselves' but also stated 'we do have some questions like it's very elementary, you know, like things like drill downs.' The signals show they've begun self-learning but need additional enablement to maximize this feature. Benjamin identified 'stakeholder portals' as a key use case, 'primarily for the clinicians' with plans to expand to other departments. This represents a significant opportunity to increase platform adoption through proper enablement.

Call Title: Domo <> Compliance: Departmental Dashboard/Analytics Requirement Gathering
Call Attendees: Inna Levin, Home Health Administrator, Client; Marlee Moleta, No Title, Client; Bellamy Yoo, Director, Client; Benjamin Parker, Senior Program Manager, Domo
Call Recap: Domo team members discussed the compliance department's use of various systems, including Monday.com, Carestitch, and Kinser, to manage patient admissions and data. They explored opportunities to optimize the data flow and reporting processes, focusing on automating manual tasks, analyzing productivity metrics, and addressing technical challenges with data integration and visualization in Domo.

name: Umbrella Use Case Identified
summary: Workflow Automation & Operational Efficiency: The client wants to optimize their compliance workflows by consolidating systems and reducing manual data entry. They currently use multiple systems requiring duplicate data entry which is inefficient and resource-intensive.
rationale: Inna stated they 'wanted to get rid of Monday and transition to Domo for all this informational stuff' because they're 'using too many programs at the same time' and 'we really wanted to see about optimization.' This clearly indicates a workflow automation and operational efficiency use case.
action_context: 1. Document specific workflow inefficiencies to target for automation. 2. Develop a phased approach to consolidate data from multiple systems into Domo. 3. Create a proposal showing potential time/resource savings from workflow optimization.

name: Problem Identified
summary: The compliance team is experiencing significant inefficiencies due to manual data transfer between multiple systems. This results in duplicate work, wasted resources, and potential for errors in critical compliance tracking.
rationale: Inna explicitly stated the problem: 'we just copy information from one program and entering to another, just manually, which actually not very optimal' and 'we're losing our resources.' Marlee also highlighted the redundancy: 'we keep on jumping in from carestitch to Kinzer...adding concierge in carestitch...also add the concierge in Kinzer.'
action_context: 1. Quantify the current time spent on manual data transfers. 2. Identify the highest-impact workflows to prioritize for automation. 3. Develop use cases showing how Domo can reduce or eliminate these manual processes.

name: Architecture Gap Identified
summary: A significant architecture gap exists where data must be manually transferred between multiple systems (Monday.com, Carestitch, and Kinzer). This manual process is inefficient and wastes resources as noted by the client.
rationale: Inna explicitly stated, 'we just copy information from one program and entering to another, just manually, which actually not very optimal' and 'we're losing our resources.' Marlee also asked about finding 'a single way to enter' data instead of duplicating efforts across systems.
action_context: 1. Conduct a detailed workflow analysis to identify all manual data transfer points. 2. Develop a proposal for streamlining data flows between systems. 3. Discuss potential automation options within Domo's capabilities.
recommended_action: Implement Architecture Assessment and Optimization for Multiple System Integration
signal_rationale: The client is struggling with inefficient workflows due to manual data transfers between multiple systems (Monday.com, Carestitch, Kinzer, Snowflake, etc.). Inna explicitly stated 'we just copy information from one program and entering to another, just manually, which actually not very optimal' and 'we're losing our resources.' Multiple signals indicate integration challenges with systems like Lever, Paylocity, and RingCentral. The client has expressed interest in consolidating systems and reducing manual work, with Bellamy stating they're 'trying to move it to Salesforce' and want to 'tie every single one of our back end office functions into one environment.'
Play 1 Description: Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: deliver a comprehensive evaluation of your entire Domo implementation, including data modeling, governance structures, user roles, content hierarchy, and security protocols. The assessment benchmarks your environment against Domo best practices and enterprise standards, providing a roadmap for remediation, optimization, and future readiness
Play 2 Name: Domo instance Optimization
Play 2 Description: Non-Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: provides a health check and performance audit of your Domo environment. It includes evaluation of dataflows, dataset duplication, memory usage, dashboard performance, connector health, and governance controls. The result is a set of prioritized recommendations to streamline performance, improve manageability, and extend platform longevity.
Play 3 Description: Non-Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: ocuses on streamlining your data ingestion and transformation processes. It includes auditing ETL logic, identifying inefficiencies in recursive or chained dataflows, removing redundant datasets, and implementing best practices for scheduling and resource usage. The result is faster, more reliable data pipelines that scale with business growth.

name: Architecture Gap Identified
summary: A SQL issue has caused 90% of rows to be dropped from an 'open order' dataset, impacting downstream reporting. This architecture gap is causing data integrity issues that grow more severe each day.
rationale: William stated: 'That open order deal where the sequel dropped. Well, 90 percent of the rows... it's a daily snapshot. So, the more it impacts, all of that reporting.' The issue has been escalated but remains unresolved, suggesting a significant architectural weakness.
action_context: 1. Follow up immediately on the escalated ticket regarding the SQL issue dropping 90% of rows. 2. Assess impact on downstream reporting and identify temporary workarounds. 3. Once resolved, conduct root cause analysis to prevent similar issues in the future.
recommended_action: Implement Domo Pipeline Optimization to address SQL issue causing data loss
signal_rationale: The client is experiencing a critical architecture gap where a SQL issue is causing 90% of rows to be dropped from their 'open order' dataset, severely impacting downstream reporting. This is a high-priority issue that grows more severe each day. A Pipeline Optimization engagement would help identify and fix the SQL issue, audit the ETL logic, and implement best practices to prevent similar issues in the future.

The result is faster, more reliable data pipelines that scale with business growth.

name: Feature Gap / Request
summary: There appears to be an upcoming certificate validation change in Domo that's causing password change alerts to appear for the client. Understanding how SSO integrations will be affected by platform changes is critical for maintaining seamless access.
rationale: William mentioned: 'we've got this password change alert that's popping up' and referenced a response from Mohawk about Domo SSO, stating 'we are only signing the saml request from our side. We are not validating the certificate from the Domo side. This change will not affect us.'
action_context: 1. Verify that the upcoming certificate changes on the 25th will indeed not impact the client's SSO implementation. 2. Ensure the client understands why they're receiving password change alerts if they won't be affected. 3. Document the client's specific SSO configuration for future reference.
recommended_action: Schedule Feature Demo/Deep Dive Enablement on SSO certificate validation changes
signal_rationale: The client is experiencing password change alerts related to upcoming certificate validation changes in Domo that may affect their SSO integration. While they've received some information about it not affecting them, there appears to be confusion as they're still seeing alerts. A targeted enablement session would help clarify how these platform changes impact their specific SSO implementation and ensure they understand how to properly configure their environment.

This is a high-priority issue that grows more severe each day. A Pipeline Optimization engagement would help identify and fix the SQL issue, audit the ETL logic, and implement best practices to prevent similar issues in the future., The client mentioned their Swatchbox connector is working well, but as this is an important external integration for their data ecosystem, it would be beneficial to ensure it's properly documented and optimized. This would help maintain workflow continuity and potentially identify opportunities for enhancement. The Configuration Architecture play would help ensure this integration is set up according to best practices and properly documented for future reference., The client is experiencing password change alerts related to upcoming certificate validation changes in Domo that may affect their SSO integration. While they've received some information about it not affecting them, there appears to be confusion as they're still seeing alerts. A targeted enablement session would help clarify how these platform changes impact their specific SSO implementation and ensure they understand how to properly configure their environment.
play_1_description: Non-Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: focuses on building a scalable, sustainable Domo architecture from the ground up or enhancing your current setup. It includes best practices for dataset design, dataflows, user roles, PDP (Personalized Data Permissions), and page structure, all tailored to your organizational structure and data needs. This ensures the platform is optimized for governance, flexibility, performance, and ease of management.
Call Attendees: William McCall, Manager, Client; Michael Dixon II, Sr. Customer Success Manager, Domo; Omar Duarte, Manager, Client
Call Recap: Domo team members discussed challenges with transitioning a child back to the school schedule, William's experience managing his family's ranch, and concerns about a power line project impacting his property. The team also addressed a SQL issue impacting reporting data, upcoming product changes, and the upcoming Connections Tour event, with Michael committing to follow up with relevant updates and information.

name: CDW Identified
summary: The customer is migrating their ETL processing and data into Databricks, which will serve as their new data source for Domo. This migration to a cloud data warehouse requires careful planning to minimize impact on existing Domo assets and workflows.
rationale: Shilpa explicitly stated 'our data engineering team, we are working on this migration and moving our ETL like our processing as well as our data into databricks.' She further mentioned that the challenge is how to get data from Databricks into Domo with minimal downstream impact.
action_context: 1. Document the full scope of Databricks migration. 2. Evaluate Cloud Amplifier integration options specifically for Databricks. 3. Create a detailed migration plan that preserves downstream dependencies.
recommended_action: Schedule a technical deep dive on Cloud Amplifier for Databricks integration
signal_rationale: The customer is actively migrating their ETL processing and data to Databricks and exploring Cloud Amplifier as an integration option with Domo. Call Title: Ford Direct + Domo: Solutioning Call (Cloud Amp DataSet Migrations)
Call Attendees: Shilpa Chattopadhyay, No Title, Unknown; Zoe Tidwell, Data Engineer, Client; Savannah Olson, Senior Technical Support Advisor, Domo; Casey Dorman, No Title, Domo
Call Recap: Savannah, Jake and Casey from Domo, along with Zoe from Dealer Direct LLC, discussed the challenges of migrating Dealer Direct's ETL and data processing to Databricks while ensuring minimal downstream impact on their existing ODBC datasets in Domo. The key highlights were the recommendation to manually switch the data sets for the cards, the potential issues with using the Cloud Amplifier dataset, and the exploration of alternative options like the Databricks connector and programmatic updates to ETLs, views, and alerts, with a plan to schedule a follow-up call to provide further guidance.

name: Source-System Identified
summary: The customer currently uses Domo Workbench to create ODBC datasets that feed into their Domo instance. Understanding this current architecture is crucial for planning a smooth transition to Databricks as the new source system.
rationale: Shilpa mentioned 'we have all these datasets which are already set up in Domo, they have been created by us using the Domo workbench tool. So they're created as odbc datasets'
action_context: 1. Audit existing Workbench ODBC datasets to understand current state. 2. Map current ODBC connections to future Databricks equivalents. 3. Create a side-by-side comparison of current vs. future state architecture.
recommended_action: Develop a phased migration strategy for transitioning from Workbench ODBC datasets to Databricks
signal_rationale: The customer has identified a gap in their migration strategy regarding how to transfer downstream dependencies (ETLs, cards, alerts) when changing dataset sources. They currently use Domo Workbench for ODBC datasets and need a clear plan to maintain business continuity during the transition to Databricks.
Play 1 Name: Configuration Architecture -Setting up your Domo architecture for innovation, manageability, and governance.
Play 1 Description: Non-Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: focuses on building a scalable, sustainable Domo architecture from the ground up or enhancing your current setup. It includes best practices for dataset design, dataflows, user roles, PDP (Personalized Data Permissions), and page structure, all tailored to your organizational structure and data needs. This ensures the platform is optimized for governance, flexibility, performance, and ease of management.
Play 2 Name: Domo instance Optimization
Play 2 Description: Non-Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: provides a health check and performance audit of your Domo environment. It includes evaluation of dataflows, dataset duplication, memory usage, dashboard performance, connector health, and governance controls. The result is a set of prioritized recommendations to streamline performance, improve manageability, and extend platform longevity.
Play 3 Description: Non-Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: ocuses on streamlining your data ingestion and transformation processes. It includes auditing ETL logic, identifying inefficiencies in recursive or chained dataflows, removing redundant datasets, and implementing best practices for scheduling and resource usage. The result is faster, more reliable data pipelines that scale with business growth.

name: Architecture Gap Identified
summary: The customer is experiencing data integration issues where their financial recovery data isn't linking together properly until items are invoiced. This is causing delays in reporting and limiting their ability to quickly demonstrate the full value of their solution.
rationale: Jason mentioned: 'we have some issues where how I have this link the data has to, it has to be invoiced before all the data links together. So like this will probably keep going up though' and 'my focus is on this and watching the data flow and figuring out like making or getting all the data in here hopefully quicker.'
action_context: 1. Explore data architecture improvements to address the invoice-dependent data linking issue. 2. Consider implementing interim data solutions that could provide more timely insights before invoicing occurs. 3. Review the current data model to identify opportunities for optimization.

AI Account Signal Context: Schedule a technical demo focused on Domo's BigQuery connector capabilities and data pipeline optimization, Develop a proof of concept for the paint department SKU analysis use case with Todd from merchandising, Document and promote the significant business value realized ($5M in COGS identified, $807K recovered) as an internal case study
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: Multiple signals indicate Home Depot is using BigQuery as their cloud data warehouse and experiencing challenges with data handling. Todd specifically expressed interest in learning how to pull data directly from BigQuery tables rather than Excel pivot tables. Jason is actively using BigQuery connections but mentioned integration challenges. The large dataset of 77 million records they're working with requires optimized data handling. A technical demo would address these needs while showcasing Domo's competitive advantages over their current Tableau implementation., Multiple signals indicate an emerging use case in the paint department with significant revenue potential. Todd is working in the paint department and expressed interest in using Domo. Phil mentioned this use case could impact "a million dollars a month" by optimizing product placement and impulse purchases. Todd has prior Domo experience from Target, making him a potential champion. The merchandising team currently relies heavily on Excel pivot tables, presenting an opportunity to demonstrate Domo's superior capabilities., Multiple signals demonstrate exceptional business value already realized through Domo implementations. Jason has identified $5 million in COGS and recovered $807K in just three weeks from the recycling project. This success was recognized with a Homer award from leadership (Katie). Another implementation showed $2 million in COGS over 10 days with $200K in recovery. These concrete ROI examples should be documented and leveraged to drive expansion across other Home Depot departments.

This financial reporting initiative has already identified over $2 million in unrealized COGS and recovered $133,000 in just 11 days.
rationale: Jason explicitly described a financial reporting use case where they're now tracking COGS that were previously unrealized: 'we're well over 2,000,000 dollars of cogs that were previously unrealized like we were giving them away.' He also mentioned they've recovered '$133,000 so far' and are 'bringing in another 100K a week' that they weren't capturing before.
action_context: 1. Help the customer build more sophisticated dashboards to better visualize and tell the story of this financial impact. 2. Explore opportunities to expand this use case to other facilities or product categories. 3. Document this as a success story with quantifiable ROI for future reference.

AI Account Signal Context Rationale: Multiple signals indicate that Dale Whitchurch (identified champion) is experiencing significant technical challenges with App Studio, workflow permissions, and filter context persistence. These issues are causing frustration and potential risk to the relationship. Dale has been described as 'an amazing champion' who 'uses every piece of our platform' but is hitting limitations that require specialized technical support. The tone has shifted negatively with Dale expressing that it's 'getting really frustrating' and they're 'kind of guessing on our own' despite flagging issues 'early in the year.', Signals indicate Dale Whitchurch is the sole technical expert for Domo within IPG Health, creating a potential knowledge gap and single point of failure. Michael noted 'his skill set is so high that there's not really anyone else, in his orbit that has, the capabilities...to understand what Dale's trying to do and help him figure it out.' With the complex implementation involving App Studio, Workflows, and Code Engine across multiple instances, and with upcoming releases affecting nearly 1,000 users, this dependency creates significant risk., Multiple signals indicate IPG Health is undergoing an acquisition by Omnicom (announced in December), creating urgency to complete numerous Domo projects. Lizzie mentioned they're 'in the middle of an acquisition' which has impacted their FP&A system implementation plans. Michael stated there's 'a big push on the ipg side to get a lot of these projects through the door' due to the acquisition. This represents both a risk and opportunity for the Domo relationship during this transition period.

name: Feature Gap / Request
summary: The customer is experiencing issues with workflow permissions and the ability to refresh collections at the end of workflow runs. This gap is impacting their ability to automate data refreshes at desired times.
rationale: Karl stated, 'It's just related to refreshing a collection at the end. When the workflow runs, it's not working for some reason.' He also mentioned, 'the collection will refresh itself eventually, but it would be nice if it happens when we want it to,' indicating a feature limitation.
action_context: 1. Escalate the workflow collection refresh issue to product management. 2. Document the specific permissions requirements for workflow execution to prevent similar issues. 3. Develop a clear workaround process until the feature gap is addressed.
recommended_action: Schedule a technical session focused on App Studio and workflow permissions issues with a product expert
signal_rationale: Multiple signals indicate that Dale Whitchurch (identified champion) is experiencing significant technical challenges with App Studio, workflow permissions, and filter context persistence. These issues are causing frustration and potential risk to the relationship. Dale has been described as 'an amazing champion' who 'uses every piece of our platform' but is hitting limitations that require specialized technical support. The tone has shifted negatively with Dale expressing that it's 'getting really frustrating' and they're 'kind of guessing on our own' despite flagging issues 'early in the year.'

name: Architecture Gap Identified
summary: The customer is experiencing permission-related issues that are preventing workflows from functioning properly. This represents an architectural gap in how permissions are structured and managed within their implementation.
rationale: Karl stated, 'It's like my bane, right? It's like giving what kind of permissions do people need to run these workflows? I think that we've given them everything they should need. But for some reason, it still isn't working and it does look like it's permissions issue.'
action_context: 1. Conduct a comprehensive audit of the permissions structure to identify inconsistencies. 2. Develop a permissions matrix specifically for workflows to ensure proper access. 3. Consider implementing role-based access controls to simplify permission management.

name: Architecture Gap Identified
summary: Jack identified a potential architecture gap related to data dictionary management and field naming conflicts across multiple datasets. This structural challenge could impact their ability to effectively implement natural language querying across dashboards powered by multiple datasets.
rationale: Jack expressed concerns about 'data collisions' stating: 'we have, you know, whatever 100 different data sets and sometimes the context of status, you know, there may be multiple fields called like status.' He specifically asked about recommendations for handling these naming conflicts when implementing AI features.
action_context: 1. Provide best practices documentation on data dictionary management for AI implementations. 2. Schedule a technical session focused on field aliasing strategies. 3. Review their current dashboard architecture to identify potential naming conflict issues before they implement natural language querying.

account_name: United Parcel Service Oasis Supply Corporation
name: Umbrella Use Case Identified
summary: Customer Experience & Support: The client is exploring AI capabilities to enhance their Symphony tier two offerings, allowing customers to ask ad hoc questions of their data. This indicates a focus on improving customer self-service and data interaction capabilities.
rationale: Casey mentioned 'They were looking at like the Domo chats, and to improve the symphony tier two offerings. So customers can come in and ask, you know, ad hoc questions of their data.' This clearly indicates an interest in using Domo AI for customer-facing support and experience enhancement.
action_context: 1. Schedule a follow-up session specifically focused on Symphony tier two offerings and Domo chat integration. 2. Prepare case studies showing successful customer-facing AI implementations. 3. Develop a proof of concept for UPS showing how customers can interact with their data through natural language queries.
recommended_action: Schedule AI Agents & Readiness assessment for on-time delivery prediction use case
signal_rationale: UPS is exploring AI capabilities within Domo, with specific interest in forecasting and predicting on-time deliveries for their international air freight operations. Parsa confirmed this would be valuable: 'It is definitely a good proactive type of thing that would tell us, hey, these shipments are at risk and it could help us to save and improve our time in transit.' Raveendra has already submitted an AI use case for review through UPS's AI governance team. The team is also interested in AI chat capabilities, auto summarization, insights generation, and auto content building. They're considering integration with multiple AI models including Google Gemini, OpenAI via Azure, and Databricks.
Play 1 Name: AI Agents & Readiness - Seamless AI integration with targeted assessments and strategies.
Play 1 Description: Non-Billed, Hours-Based Consulting Offering: supports organizations in preparing for and deploying AI use cases in Domo. This includes evaluating your current data landscape, identifying AI-ready use cases, recommending ML tools or integrations (such as Domo’s AI Service Layer or 3rd party connectors), and developing governance around AI usage. The goal is to enable intelligent automation, predictive insights, and human-AI collaboration through a controlled, value-driven approach.
Play 2 Name: AI Agents & Readiness - Seamless AI integration with targeted assessments and strategies.

AI Account Signal Context Rationale: Multiple signals indicate recurring issues with sandbox-to-production migrations, particularly with partitioned datasets, variable controls, and app promotions. Raymond is 'constantly reaching out' for access to datasets created in the virtual machine. There are specific errors when promoting cards from UAT to production, with Mamta noting 'we are not fully supporting partition via sandbox' and recommending building in prod directly. These architectural limitations are causing workflow bottlenecks and preventing efficient deployment of critical dashboards, including healthcare reporting., UPS is exploring AI capabilities within Domo, with specific interest in forecasting and predicting on-time deliveries for their international air freight operations. Parsa confirmed this would be valuable: 'It is definitely a good proactive type of thing that would tell us, hey, these shipments are at risk and it could help us to save and improve our time in transit.' Raveendra has already submitted an AI use case for review through UPS's AI governance team. The team is also interested in AI chat capabilities, auto summarization, insights generation, and auto content building. They're considering integration with multiple AI models including Google Gemini, OpenAI via Azure, and Databricks., Multiple signals show UPS is working on a financial forecasting project that requires Domo integration with Google BigQuery. Regina shared her current manual process of creating daily, weekly, and monthly forecasts for leadership using screen scrapes from websites. The team is waiting for BigQuery access credentials to begin implementation. They have a 'wish list' of metrics including volume and revenue by day, region, product, customer, and revenue-specific items like discounts and fuel surcharges. This represents a significant opportunity to replace manual processes with automated reporting and provide leadership with more comprehensive forecasting capabilities.

Call Title: UPS + Domo: AI Products & Capabilities Overview (+ Use Case Exploration)
Call Attendees: Chris Lucksted, Systems Reporting Analyst, Client; Casey Dorman, No Title, Domo; Braxton Fullenkamp, No Title, Domo; Kathy Hlebica, Director, Ocean Freight and Supplier Management Services, Client; Noman Syed, Lead Data Steward & Data Platform Management, Client
Call Recap: Domo team members discussed Domo's AI capabilities, including large language models, text-to-SQL conversion, image-to-text extraction, and AI-powered data analysis and forecasting. The group explored potential use cases for Domo's AI, such as automating data validation and cleansing, generating executive-level reports, and leveraging AI for market predictions and supply chain analysis. The discussion also covered cost considerations and the need to establish a structured process for evaluating and implementing AI use cases within the organization.

account_name: United Parcel Service Oasis Supply Corporation
name: Feature Gap / Request
summary: The client is exploring Domo AI capabilities including auto summarization, insights generation, and auto content building. These features represent potential gaps in their current analytics workflow that they're looking to address.
rationale: Casey mentioned specific AI features they're interested in: 'They're also looking at the auto summarization and insights piece where you can take an app, studio page or a dashboard and ask it... what are the important insights... and then auto content building where you can ask AI to actually build a card or dashboard for you.' This indicates specific feature requests or gaps they're looking to fill.
action_context: 1. Demonstrate how Domo AI's auto summarization and content building features work with UPS's specific data. 2. Create a feature comparison showing how these capabilities enhance their current workflow. 3. Develop a roadmap showing implementation phases for these AI capabilities.

name: External Integration
summary: UPS is interested in integrating Domo AI with multiple external AI models and services, including those from Google Gemini, OpenAI via Azure, and Databricks. This indicates a sophisticated approach to AI implementation requiring multiple integration points.

name: Business Goal Identified
summary: UPS aims to improve their time in transit for shipments by proactively identifying at-risk deliveries. This goal directly impacts their operational efficiency and customer satisfaction in their international air freight operations.
rationale: Parsa states: 'It is definitely a good like a proactive type of thing that would tell us, hey, these shipments are at risk and it could help us to save and improve our time in transit.' Casey also mentions that Todd had identified this could 'save days worth of time in delivery operations.'
action_context: Develop a business value proposition specifically around time in transit improvements. Collect baseline metrics to measure potential improvements. Prepare case studies from similar implementations that demonstrate quantifiable improvements in delivery times.

AI Account Signal Context: Schedule Domo Architecture Assessment to address sandbox-to-production migration issues, Schedule AI Agents & Readiness assessment for on-time delivery prediction use case, Implement a Financial Planning Data Product for the international forecasting project
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: Multiple signals indicate recurring issues with sandbox-to-production migrations, particularly with partitioned datasets, variable controls, and app promotions. Raymond is 'constantly reaching out' for access to datasets created in the virtual machine. There are specific errors when promoting cards from UAT to production, with Mamta noting 'we are not fully supporting partition via sandbox' and recommending building in prod directly. These architectural limitations are causing workflow bottlenecks and preventing efficient deployment of critical dashboards, including healthcare reporting., UPS is exploring AI capabilities within Domo, with specific interest in forecasting and predicting on-time deliveries for their international air freight operations. Parsa confirmed this would be valuable: 'It is definitely a good proactive type of thing that would tell us, hey, these shipments are at risk and it could help us to save and improve our time in transit.' Raveendra has already submitted an AI use case for review through UPS's AI governance team. The team is also interested in AI chat capabilities, auto summarization, insights generation, and auto content building. They're considering integration with multiple AI models including Google Gemini, OpenAI via Azure, and Databricks., Multiple signals show UPS is working on a financial forecasting project that requires Domo integration with Google BigQuery. Regina shared her current manual process of creating daily, weekly, and monthly forecasts for leadership using screen scrapes from websites. The team is waiting for BigQuery access credentials to begin implementation. They have a 'wish list' of metrics including volume and revenue by day, region, product, customer, and revenue-specific items like discounts and fuel surcharges. This represents a significant opportunity to replace manual processes with automated reporting and provide leadership with more comprehensive forecasting capabilities.

AI Account Signal Context Rationale: Multiple signals indicate recurring issues with sandbox-to-production migrations, particularly with partitioned datasets, variable controls, and app promotions. Raymond is 'constantly reaching out' for access to datasets created in the virtual machine. There are specific errors when promoting cards from UAT to production, with Mamta noting 'we are not fully supporting partition via sandbox' and recommending building in prod directly. Regina shared her current manual process of creating daily, weekly, and monthly forecasts for leadership using screen scrapes from websites. The team is waiting for BigQuery access credentials to begin implementation. They have a 'wish list' of metrics including volume and revenue by day, region, product, customer, and revenue-specific items like discounts and fuel surcharges. This represents a significant opportunity to replace manual processes with automated reporting and provide leadership with more comprehensive forecasting capabilities.

Michael stated there's 'a big push on the ipg side to get a lot of these projects through the door' due to the acquisition. This represents both a risk and opportunity for the Domo relationship during this transition period.

name: Umbrella Use Case Identified
summary: Sales Performance & Revenue Optimization: The merchandising team at Home Depot has identified a use case for analyzing SKU performance at paint desks across regions to optimize product placement and boost impulse buys. This could significantly impact front-end revenue by determining which products perform best in high-visibility locations.
rationale: Phil mentioned a call with the merchandising team where they discussed analyzing paint desk SKUs: 'right now there's no data collected on which SKUs do better' and they want to analyze regional performance differences. He also mentioned potential AB testing to determine which products drive the most impulse purchases without cannibalizing sales, noting it 'could impact so much' including 'impacting a 1,000,000 dollars a month.'
action_context: Follow up with the merchandising team to develop a detailed implementation plan for the SKU analysis dashboard. Prepare demonstration of how Domo can visualize regional performance differences and support AB testing methodologies. Quantify potential revenue impact to strengthen business case.

name: Architecture Gap Identified
summary: The team identified a significant data integration challenge with a 2-month wait time for SFTP setup, creating a bottleneck for data access. This architectural gap is forcing manual data handling in the interim and delaying implementation of automated workflows.
rationale: Jayden mentioned: 'they finally got the sftp eta and it's like two months out' and explained it's 'someone's side project.' Jason expressed surprise at the timeline: 'two months to set up an sftp?' Jayden further clarified this impacts their ability 'to get data to them via an import instead of having to do things manually.'
action_context: Explore alternative data integration methods that don't rely on SFTP to bypass the 2-month wait. Engage with IT leadership to potentially elevate the priority of the SFTP setup. Develop interim solutions that minimize manual data handling while waiting for proper integration.

AI Account Signal Context: Schedule Domo Architecture Assessment to address sandbox-to-production migration issues, Schedule AI Agents & Readiness assessment for on-time delivery prediction use case, Implement a Financial Planning Data Product for the international forecasting project
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: Multiple signals indicate recurring issues with sandbox-to-production migrations, particularly with partitioned datasets, variable controls, and app promotions. Raymond is 'constantly reaching out' for access to datasets created in the virtual machine. There are specific errors when promoting cards from UAT to production, with Mamta noting 'we are not fully supporting partition via sandbox' and recommending building in prod directly. These architectural limitations are causing workflow bottlenecks and preventing efficient deployment of critical dashboards, including healthcare reporting., UPS is exploring AI capabilities within Domo, with specific interest in forecasting and predicting on-time deliveries for their international air freight operations. Parsa confirmed this would be valuable: 'It is definitely a good proactive type of thing that would tell us, hey, these shipments are at risk and it could help us to save and improve our time in transit.' Raveendra has already submitted an AI use case for review through UPS's AI governance team. The team is also interested in AI chat capabilities, auto summarization, insights generation, and auto content building. They're considering integration with multiple AI models including Google Gemini, OpenAI via Azure, and Databricks., Multiple signals show UPS is working on a financial forecasting project that requires Domo integration with Google BigQuery. Regina shared her current manual process of creating daily, weekly, and monthly forecasts for leadership using screen scrapes from websites. The team is waiting for BigQuery access credentials to begin implementation. They have a 'wish list' of metrics including volume and revenue by day, region, product, customer, and revenue-specific items like discounts and fuel surcharges. This represents a significant opportunity to replace manual processes with automated reporting and provide leadership with more comprehensive forecasting capabilities.

name: Umbrella Use Case Identified
summary: Workflow Automation & Operational Efficiency: IPG Health is looking to streamline access to multiple Domo instances through an identity broker solution. This would create a single entry point for users to access all relevant Domo environments, improving operational efficiency and user experience.
rationale: Karl explicitly stated their need for workflow improvement: 'we would like an easier way for our users to access their instances right now... we'd like to look at using the identity broker... to give everyone one URL, where they can access all Domo instances from, no matter who they are.' This clearly aligns with automating and streamlining operational processes.
action_context: 1. Develop a proposal for implementing the identity broker solution that addresses IPG's specific multi-instance architecture. 2. Quantify potential time savings and user experience improvements to demonstrate ROI. 3. Create a project plan that includes testing with both employee and customer user types.

AI Account Signal Context: Schedule a technical session focused on App Studio and workflow permissions issues with a product expert, Implement a knowledge transfer plan to build additional Domo expertise beyond Dale Whitchurch, Develop a merger/acquisition support plan to ensure continuity of Domo projects
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: Multiple signals indicate that Dale Whitchurch (identified champion) is experiencing significant technical challenges with App Studio, workflow permissions, and filter context persistence. These issues are causing frustration and potential risk to the relationship. Dale has been described as 'an amazing champion' who 'uses every piece of our platform' but is hitting limitations that require specialized technical support. The tone has shifted negatively with Dale expressing that it's 'getting really frustrating' and they're 'kind of guessing on our own' despite flagging issues 'early in the year.', Signals indicate Dale Whitchurch is the sole technical expert for Domo within IPG Health, creating a potential knowledge gap and single point of failure. Michael noted 'his skill set is so high that there's not really anyone else, in his orbit that has, the capabilities...to understand what Dale's trying to do and help him figure it out.' With the complex implementation involving App Studio, Workflows, and Code Engine across multiple instances, and with upcoming releases affecting nearly 1,000 users, this dependency creates significant risk., Multiple signals indicate IPG Health is undergoing an acquisition by Omnicom (announced in December), creating urgency to complete numerous Domo projects. Lizzie mentioned they're 'in the middle of an acquisition' which has impacted their FP&A system implementation plans. Michael stated there's 'a big push on the ipg side to get a lot of these projects through the door' due to the acquisition. This represents both a risk and opportunity for the Domo relationship during this transition period.

name: Architecture Gap Identified
summary: IPG Health has identified a structural gap in their current architecture where users need to log into multiple separate Domo instances directly. name: Data Distribution Identified
summary: IPG Health has a complex multi-instance architecture with data distributed across main, agency, and customer instances. This distribution approach is intentionally designed to maintain data security by isolating sensitive information and providing appropriate access to different user groups.
rationale: Karl shared their screen showing 'a high level view of the instance architecture' with 'the main ipg health instance, and then we have some agency instances. And then we also have some customer instances'. He explained 'We've taken this approach because we wanted to separate away where people can develop. We have for example, some very sensitive data in the ipg health instance. We don't want any risks around editors and privileged people accidentally getting access to that from the agency.'
action_context: 1. Document the current multi-instance architecture to ensure all team members understand the design rationale. 2. Evaluate if the identity broker solution can maintain the intended security boundaries while improving access. 3. Consider reviewing data governance practices across instances to ensure consistent security protocols.

name: Relationship Gap / Exposure
summary: There is a relationship gap with Meekum, who is described as Katie's boss's boss and someone Justin wants to stay connected with regarding strategy. His absence from regular calls due to being busy represents a potential relationship risk that could impact strategic alignment.
rationale: Justin specifically asks about Meekum ('How's my boy meekum, doing? Is he gonna join one of these?'). Katie mentions he's too busy to join calls ('he is a busy little bee') and that 'making it the call is really hard for him right now.' Justin expresses wanting to ensure Meekum 'knows exactly where we're at with this, and he feels good about the strategy.'
action_context: 1. Include Meekum in email communications to keep him informed. 2. Consider scheduling a dedicated, less frequent strategic check-in with Meekum. 3. Prepare a strategic summary document that can be shared with Meekum to maintain alignment without requiring his presence on every call.
recommended_action: Schedule an executive-level meeting with Meekum to address strategic alignment and relationship gap
signal_rationale: Multiple signals indicate a relationship gap with a key stakeholder (Meekum) who is described as 'Katie's boss's boss' and someone Justin wants to 'stay connected with regarding strategy.' Meekum is missing regular calls due to being busy, which represents a relationship risk that could impact strategic alignment. Additionally, there's frustration about project momentum with Tim noting they had 'a great start' but now the client is going 'dark for weeks at a time.' An executive-level meeting would help re-establish communication channels and reinvigorate project momentum.

The tone has shifted negatively with Dale expressing that it's 'getting really frustrating' and they're 'kind of guessing on our own' despite flagging issues 'early in the year.', Signals indicate Dale Whitchurch is the sole technical expert for Domo within IPG Health, creating a potential knowledge gap and single point of failure. With the complex implementation involving App Studio, Workflows, and Code Engine across multiple instances, and with upcoming releases affecting nearly 1,000 users, this dependency creates significant risk., Multiple signals indicate IPG Health is undergoing an acquisition by Omnicom (announced in December), creating urgency to complete numerous Domo projects. Lizzie mentioned they're 'in the middle of an acquisition' which has impacted their FP&A system implementation plans. Michael stated there's 'a big push on the ipg side to get a lot of these projects through the door' due to the acquisition. This represents both a risk and opportunity for the Domo relationship during this transition period.

Call Recap: Michael and Joe from Domo, along with Dale and Karl from IPG Health, LLC, discussed the upcoming onsite meetings to gather requirements, prioritize them, and determine the MVP budget and timeline, as well as the target state budget and timeline. They also discussed the challenges in persisting filters between custom apps and explored potential workarounds, with Michael offering to reach out to Shane for an update on the hotfix, and Joe agreeing to check with the other Michael for insights on building apps with Domo.

name: Due Date Provided
summary: The team has committed to delivering the final requirements specification and pricing by the end of July, with onsite requirements gathering happening next Wednesday through Friday. This timeline is critical for IPG's product development planning.
rationale: Michael states: 'So, I think the estimate is two weeks to three weeks after, well, including next week, right? Next week plus two for the final deliverable.' Dale confirms: 'So, end of July.' Michael agrees: 'Yes. And I'm trying to push them to get it in sooner.'
action_context: 1. Ensure all team members are aware of the end-of-July deadline for the final deliverable. 2. Create a project plan with clear milestones to meet this timeline. 3. Schedule check-in points with Dale after the onsite sessions to prevent delays.

AI Account Signal Context Rationale: Multiple signals indicate recurring issues with sandbox-to-production migrations, particularly with partitioned datasets, variable controls, and app promotions. Raymond is 'constantly reaching out' for access to datasets created in the virtual machine. There are specific errors when promoting cards from UAT to production, with Mamta noting 'we are not fully supporting partition via sandbox' and recommending building in prod directly. These architectural limitations are causing workflow bottlenecks and preventing efficient deployment of critical dashboards, including healthcare reporting., UPS is exploring AI capabilities within Domo, with specific interest in forecasting and predicting on-time deliveries for their international air freight operations. Parsa confirmed this would be valuable: 'It is definitely a good proactive type of thing that would tell us, hey, these shipments are at risk and it could help us to save and improve our time in transit.' Raveendra has already submitted an AI use case for review through UPS's AI governance team. The team is also interested in AI chat capabilities, auto summarization, insights generation, and auto content building. They're considering integration with multiple AI models including Google Gemini, OpenAI via Azure, and Databricks., Multiple signals show UPS is working on a financial forecasting project that requires Domo integration with Google BigQuery. Regina shared her current manual process of creating daily, weekly, and monthly forecasts for leadership using screen scrapes from websites. The team is waiting for BigQuery access credentials to begin implementation. They have a 'wish list' of metrics including volume and revenue by day, region, product, customer, and revenue-specific items like discounts and fuel surcharges. This represents a significant opportunity to replace manual processes with automated reporting and provide leadership with more comprehensive forecasting capabilities.

AI Account Signal Context: Implement Architecture Assessment and Optimization for Multiple System Integration, Implement HR & Talent Acquisition Data Product for Employee Analytics, Provide App Studio Training and Enablement for Portal Development
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: The client is struggling with inefficient workflows due to manual data transfers between multiple systems (Monday.com, Carestitch, Kinzer, Snowflake, etc.). Inna explicitly stated 'we just copy information from one program and entering to another, just manually, which actually not very optimal' and 'we're losing our resources.' Multiple signals indicate integration challenges with systems like Lever, Paylocity, and RingCentral. The client has expressed interest in consolidating systems and reducing manual work, with Bellamy stating they're 'trying to move it to Salesforce' and want to 'tie every single one of our back end office functions into one environment.', Multiple signals indicate a strong need for HR and talent acquisition analytics. The client is building department dashboards for HR and TA with specific requirements for tracking employee turnover, reasons for termination, and hiring metrics. Bea (HR) stated 'I want it by region. I want it by title. I want it by reason why they're leaving voluntary versus involuntary.' Kevin (head of TA) needs 'real time data that he needs to understand different hiring needs.' The client has identified Lever and Paylocity as key data sources for these metrics, making them ideal candidates for a comprehensive HR data product., The client is actively exploring App Studio for building clinician portals and customer reports. Bellamy mentioned 'we actually went into the app studio and figured things out ourselves' but also stated 'we do have some questions like it's very elementary, you know, like things like drill downs.' The signals show they've begun self-learning but need additional enablement to maximize this feature. Benjamin identified 'stakeholder portals' as a key use case, 'primarily for the clinicians' with plans to expand to other departments. This represents a significant opportunity to increase platform adoption through proper enablement.

Call Recap: David, Michael and Jesse from Domo, along with Dale and Kyle from IPG Health, LLC, discussed the progress of a proof-of-concept (POC) using machine learning models to identify differences between documents, with the goal of finding the right balance between false positives and false negatives. The team agreed to explore a "chunking" methodology over the next two weeks to address the current approach's tendency to find too many differences, and they will have a follow-up meeting on August 22nd to decide whether to proceed with the new approach, which offers increased flexibility and customization for IPG Health's specific needs.

Call Title: Domo + Home Depot: Product Engineering SOW
Call Attendees: Phil Stewart, No Title, Domo; Umair Khan, Services Solutions Director, Domo; Brice Weeter, Prod Engineering Manager, Client; Scott Hager, Senior Manager, Product Engineering, Client; Dan Roden, No Title, Domo; Benjamin Parker, Senior Program Manager, Domo; William Dubois, No Title, Domo
Call Recap: Domo team members discussed how their platform helped a Home Depot employee recover $400,000 in cost of goods sold, and presented a proposed solution to streamline Home Depot's product lifecycle management processes, including centralizing workflows, creating structured data sets, and improving collaboration and accountability. The key highlights were the potential benefits of Domo's configurability and scalability compared to a custom solution, the need to integrate data from various sources, and the discussion around the implementation timeline and cost structure, with Domo expressing flexibility in accommodating Home Depot's budgetary and fiscal year requirements.

name: Business Value Realized
summary: Home Depot has realized significant business value through Domo, recovering $400,000 in just four days (averaging $100,000/day) by identifying high-value goods with no associated costs in their reverse logistics centers. This represents a projected $3.6 million impact from a single data transformation solution.
rationale: Phil explicitly mentioned a success story where Jason from the salvage department used Domo to identify that high-end goods (like lawnmowers) were coming into reverse logistics centers with zero cost, affecting vendor valuations. The solution has been running for only four days but has already recovered '$400,000 in total' with a projected '$3.6 million dollar impact.'
action_context: 1. Document this ROI case study formally for use with other Home Depot departments. 2. Schedule a follow-up with the salvage department to identify additional optimization opportunities. 3. Use this concrete example when discussing the potential value of the current SOW with decision-makers.
recommended_action: Document and promote the significant business value realized ($5M in COGS identified, $807K recovered) as an internal case study
signal_rationale: Multiple signals demonstrate exceptional business value already realized through Domo implementations. Jason has identified $5 million in COGS and recovered $807K in just three weeks from the recycling project. This success was recognized with a Homer award from leadership (Katie). Another implementation showed $2 million in COGS over 10 days with $200K in recovery. These concrete ROI examples should be documented and leveraged to drive expansion across other Home Depot departments.

play_2_description: Ideally, after the customer has realized value from a recent use case worth advocating to others, work with the customer's stakeholders to uncover a pathway to expand the use case roadmap into new functional areas in adjacent or complimentary teams or departments and after building the relationship, map out a new use case in that area. Lighter, or pre-cursor to the contracted advanced roadmap services.
play_2_initiating_role: Customer Success Manager, Account Executive, Professional Services, Partner
Call Title: Domo + Home Depot: Product Engineering SOW
Call Attendees: Phil Stewart, No Title, Domo; Umair Khan, Services Solutions Director, Domo; Brice Weeter, Prod Engineering Manager, Client; Scott Hager, Senior Manager, Product Engineering, Client; Dan Roden, No Title, Domo; Benjamin Parker, Senior Program Manager, Domo; William Dubois, No Title, Domo
Call Recap: Domo team members discussed how their platform helped a Home Depot employee recover $400,000 in cost of goods sold, and presented a proposed solution to streamline Home Depot's product lifecycle management processes, including centralizing workflows, creating structured data sets, and improving collaboration and accountability. The key highlights were the potential benefits of Domo's configurability and scalability compared to a custom solution, the need to integrate data from various sources, and the discussion around the implementation timeline and cost structure, with Domo expressing flexibility in accommodating Home Depot's budgetary and fiscal year requirements.

name: Umbrella Use Case Identified
summary: Inventory & Supply Chain Visibility: Home Depot is using Domo to address inventory valuation issues in their reverse logistics centers (RLCs), specifically tracking high-value returned goods that were previously entering the system without proper cost attribution.
rationale: Phil described a specific use case where Domo is helping Home Depot's salvage department identify high-value goods (like lawnmowers) that were entering their 530,000 square foot reverse logistics centers with no cost associated, affecting the valuation of goods provided to suppliers. This clearly falls under the Inventory & Supply Chain Visibility umbrella.
action_context: 1. Explore additional inventory and supply chain visibility opportunities within Home Depot's reverse logistics operations. 2. Identify other departments that might benefit from similar inventory tracking solutions. 3. Develop case studies around this specific supply chain visibility use case.

Call Title: Domo + Home Depot: Pricing Model Overview
Call Attendees: Phil Stewart, No Title, Domo; Roger Cai, Windows 10, Client; Benjamin Parker, Senior Program Manager, Domo
Call Recap: Domo team members discussed their shift to a per-credit pricing model, highlighting its benefits for Home Depot, such as unlimited users and access to premium features. They focused on Domo's data transformation capabilities, including AI-powered automation, and offered to set up a trial instance for the department head, Roger, to test the AI agent feature, which could potentially streamline their processes.

rationale: Phil mentioned 'tableau desktop, my understanding is it's kind of what home depot used across the board doesn't isn't able to leverage like the gemini models.' This clearly identifies Tableau Desktop as a key existing system.
action_context: Develop targeted materials highlighting Domo's advantages over Tableau Desktop, especially AI capabilities. Prepare migration path documentation showing how to transition from Tableau to Domo. Consider a workshop comparing the platforms.

These concrete ROI examples should be documented and leveraged to drive expansion across other Home Depot departments.

Call Title: Domo + Home Depot: Pricing Model Overview
Call Attendees: Phil Stewart, No Title, Domo; Roger Cai, Windows 10, Client; Benjamin Parker, Senior Program Manager, Domo
Call Recap: Domo team members discussed their shift to a per-credit pricing model, highlighting its benefits for Home Depot, such as unlimited users and access to premium features. They focused on Domo's data transformation capabilities, including AI-powered automation, and offered to set up a trial instance for the department head, Roger, to test the AI agent feature, which could potentially streamline their processes.

Call Recap: Domo team members discussed the use of Domo's features, including AI agents, data workflows, and personal data protection (PDP) capabilities, with the client team from Innovative Holdings. The client team expressed interest in automating the process of setting up agency dashboards and managing user access, and the Domo team provided guidance on leveraging Domo's tools to address these needs. The discussion also covered the client's progress in cleaning up and consolidating their data sets, as well as plans for a follow-up meeting to further explore the proposed solutions.

name: Feature Usage Changed
summary: The customer is experiencing inconsistent behavior with navigation features, specifically mentioning issues with the back button, home button disappearance, and problems with Domo Navigate functionality. These technical issues are disrupting their implementation and user experience.
rationale: Dale specifically mentioned 'this back button's inconsistent' and 'the home button's disappearing randomly.' He also noted that 'demo navigate is reckless with how it's navigating things' and 'the new UX is even not great with it because the toolbar is showing back up again,' indicating changes in how they're experiencing core navigation features.
action_context: 1. Document the specific navigation issues for the product team with screenshots and reproduction steps. 2. Investigate if these are known bugs with existing workarounds or fixes. 3. Provide the customer with best practices for navigation implementation to minimize issues in the interim.

AI Account Signal Context Rationale: Multiple signals indicate that Dale Whitchurch (identified champion) is experiencing significant technical challenges with App Studio, workflow permissions, and filter context persistence. These issues are causing frustration and potential risk to the relationship. Dale has been described as 'an amazing champion' who 'uses every piece of our platform' but is hitting limitations that require specialized technical support. The tone has shifted negatively with Dale expressing that it's 'getting really frustrating' and they're 'kind of guessing on our own' despite flagging issues 'early in the year.', Signals indicate Dale Whitchurch is the sole technical expert for Domo within IPG Health, creating a potential knowledge gap and single point of failure. Michael noted 'his skill set is so high that there's not really anyone else, in his orbit that has, the capabilities...to understand what Dale's trying to do and help him figure it out.' With the complex implementation involving App Studio, Workflows, and Code Engine across multiple instances, and with upcoming releases affecting nearly 1,000 users, this dependency creates significant risk., Multiple signals indicate IPG Health is undergoing an acquisition by Omnicom (announced in December), creating urgency to complete numerous Domo projects. Lizzie mentioned they're 'in the middle of an acquisition' which has impacted their FP&A system implementation plans. Michael stated there's 'a big push on the ipg side to get a lot of these projects through the door' due to the acquisition. This represents both a risk and opportunity for the Domo relationship during this transition period.

Call Attendees: Michael Napoli, No Title, Domo; Dale Whitchurch, CXO/EVP, Client; Joe Pecora, Senior Customer Success Manager, Domo; Kevin McLaughlin, No Title, Client; Karl Altern, Director, Client
Call Recap: Michael and Joe from Domo, along with IPG Health, LLC team members, discussed ongoing issues with maintaining filter context consistency across pages and tabs in their application, which has led to timing issues and inconsistencies in the user experience. The team explored various workarounds, including a solution developed by Matthew, but the core challenge remains unresolved. The primary focus is on addressing the navigation issue, and Michael plans to reach out to Ben and Jace to schedule a call to discuss the "P filters hack" and try to find a consistent solution before the upcoming training goes live.

name: Feature Gap / Request
summary: The customer is experiencing significant technical challenges with maintaining filter context when navigating between pages, tabs, and apps. This functionality gap is creating a major roadblock in their implementation and causing frustration as they've been unable to find a working solution despite multiple attempts.
rationale: Dale explicitly stated they 'cannot successfully hand off between pages and tabs and keep the filter context consistent.' They've tried various workarounds including custom bricks and P filters, but none have resolved the issue. Dale mentioned 'there's no way to read page filters' and that even 'hacky solves aren't working,' indicating a clear feature limitation.
action_context: 1. Escalate this technical limitation to Product Management as a critical customer need. 2. Work with Ben (who seems to be a technical resource) to identify if any interim solutions exist. 3. Establish a clear timeline for when this functionality might be addressed to set proper expectations with the customer.

Call Title: IPG And Domo weekly tech review
Call Attendees: Michael Napoli, No Title, Domo; Dale Whitchurch, CXO/EVP, Client; Joe Pecora, Senior Customer Success Manager, Domo; Kevin McLaughlin, No Title, Client; Karl Altern, Director, Client
Call Recap: Michael and Joe from Domo, along with IPG Health, LLC team members, discussed ongoing issues with maintaining filter context consistency across pages and tabs in their application, which has led to timing issues and inconsistencies in the user experience. The team explored various workarounds, including a solution developed by Matthew, but the core challenge remains unresolved. The primary focus is on addressing the navigation issue, and Michael plans to reach out to Ben and Jace to schedule a call to discuss the "P filters hack" and try to find a consistent solution before the upcoming training goes live.

action_context: 1. Create a detailed project timeline working backward from the October deadline. 2. Identify critical path dependencies and potential bottlenecks. 3. Establish clear milestone checkpoints to assess progress and make necessary scope adjustments.

Call Recap: Domo team members discussed strategies for delivering a Minimum Viable Product (MVP) within a tight timeline, acknowledging the need to manage stakeholder expectations and the potential risks of either delivering a limited MVP or attempting to include more features. name: Problem Identified
summary: The team is facing a significant challenge with project scope and timeline constraints. AI Account Signal Context: Schedule Domo Architecture Assessment to address sandbox-to-production migration issues, Schedule AI Agents & Readiness assessment for on-time delivery prediction use case, Implement a Financial Planning Data Product for the international forecasting project
AI Account Signal Context Rationale: Multiple signals indicate recurring issues with sandbox-to-production migrations, particularly with partitioned datasets, variable controls, and app promotions. Raymond is 'constantly reaching out' for access to datasets created in the virtual machine. There are specific errors when promoting cards from UAT to production, with Mamta noting 'we are not fully supporting partition via sandbox' and recommending building in prod directly. These architectural limitations are causing workflow bottlenecks and preventing efficient deployment of critical dashboards, including healthcare reporting., UPS is exploring AI capabilities within Domo, with specific interest in forecasting and predicting on-time deliveries for their international air freight operations. Parsa confirmed this would be valuable: 'It is definitely a good proactive type of thing that would tell us, hey, these shipments are at risk and it could help us to save and improve our time in transit.' Raveendra has already submitted an AI use case for review through UPS's AI governance team. The team is also interested in AI chat capabilities, auto summarization, insights generation, and auto content building. They're considering integration with multiple AI models including Google Gemini, OpenAI via Azure, and Databricks., Multiple signals show UPS is working on a financial forecasting project that requires Domo integration with Google BigQuery. Regina shared her current manual process of creating daily, weekly, and monthly forecasts for leadership using screen scrapes from websites. The team is waiting for BigQuery access credentials to begin implementation. They have a 'wish list' of metrics including volume and revenue by day, region, product, customer, and revenue-specific items like discounts and fuel surcharges. This represents a significant opportunity to replace manual processes with automated reporting and provide leadership with more comprehensive forecasting capabilities.

summary: The customer is struggling with inconsistent reporting data that requires manual work. They need to ensure their dashboard accurately reflects historical data (January-June) while implementing a new locking mechanism for future months to maintain data integrity.

The teams plan to schedule a follow-up meeting to discuss access to the MIP API and the required data fields to implement the proposed solution.

Call Title: Domo | Stephen F. Austin Community Health Center
Call Attendees: David Sykes, Accountant Assistant, Client; Chance Ewell, No Title, Domo; Benjamin Parker, Senior Program Manager, Domo; Linh Tran, Director, Client; Michelle Calzadilla, No Title, Client; Sabrina Purtell, No Title, Client; Shane Wright, Technical Consultant, Domo
Call Recap: Chance, Shane and Benjamin from Domo, along with David, Sabrina, Michelle and Linh from Stephen F Austin Community Health Center, Inc., discussed opportunities to assist the finance team with data entry challenges, particularly around payroll allocation and invoice processing. The group agreed to prioritize automating the invoice processing workflow, with Domo proposing a solution that would use a large language model to extract and populate invoice data into the MIP accounting system, and include an approval process. The teams plan to schedule a follow-up meeting to discuss access to the MIP API and the required data fields to implement the proposed solution.
